headline: COVID-19: Kenya Records First Three Omicron Variant Cases
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: COVID-19: Kenya Records First Three Omicron Variant Cases

description: Health CS Mutahi Kagwe confirmed on Wednesday, December 15 of the variant which is one of SARS-CoV-2 which causes COVID-19.
articleBody:
(1)

Kenya has recorded the first three cases of the Omicron COVID-19 variant from travellers coming into the country.

Health CS Mutahi Kagwe confirmed on Wednesday, December 15 of the detection of the variant which is one of SARS-CoV-2 which causes COVID-19, while addressing the Council of Governors in Mombasa.

He warned that it would be a variant that will be dominant across the world, adding that he was engaging South Africa on the matter, a variant that is spreading very fast.

“We have detected the Omicron virus among the travellers and it will be dominant across the globe,” he said.

The new variant, identified as B.1.1.529 was on Friday, November 26 declared a variant of concern by the World Health Organization (WHO) and assigned it the name Omicron.

Travellers arriving in Kenya from southern African countries had to undergo COVID-19 tests as Kenya stepped up surveillance at points of entry following reports of the new variant.

The government had initially expressed no immediate plans to ban international flights following the discovery of Omicron. According to Health Principal Secretary (PS) Susan Mochache, the government heightened surveillance in all entry points across the country to monitor the spread of the new variant.

Speaking on Sunday, November 28 at Nyaura Primary School in Kisii County, the PS stated that the country’s economy should be kept running during the COVID-19 pandemic and also urged Kenyans not to panic.

“As a government, we are fully committed, ready and prepared; our borders and airports have been secured with screening being improved,” PS Health Susan Mochache said.

headline: GSU Graduates In Viral Video Will Remain At Training Centre
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: GSU Graduates In Viral Video Will Remain At Training Centre

description: Shioso was thus surprised at their behaviour given that the unit exudes one of the highest standards of discipline among the police units.
articleBody:
The newly-graduated General Service Unit (GSU) officers who made lewd remarks in a video that went viral on Wednesday, December 8 will not be deployed to their stations until the conclusion of investigations into their behaviour.

National Police Service (NPS) Spokesperson Bruno Shioso stated that the graduates will remain at the National Police College Embakasi B Campus in Nairobi where the graduations were held while the rest of the graduates were posted to their stations.

The officers whose actions were deemed to have scared members of the public will be probed on how they joined the GSU force for the first time as well as what motivated them to join the force.

Shioso noted that the officers were young and very excited about serving the nation for the first time and the day was a big one given that President Uhuru Kenyatta was also in attendance.

“Of course, we understand these are young officers who are full of excitement for their 1st day of service. It was a big day also in terms of the chief guest present but there must be a review of what happened.

“We can’t make assumptions. We are also seeking to establish their motivation to join the service because they must fit the requirements of modern-day service,” Shioso told the Nation.

The police spokesperson also said that the investigations will also seek to establish the exact number of officers in the video before enforcing disciplinary action against them.

The group was part of the 2,502 constables who graduated as GSU officers at the National Police Training College in Embakasi B Campus after rigorous training at the Magadi Training Camp in Kajiado County.

Because of the vigorous training that the unit undergoes, the GSU is one of the most disciplined units in the police force and one of the most feared within the NPS.

Its officers join the elite teams such as the Presidential Escort and Recce Squad, with others deployed as riot control and provision of security to foreign airlines.

“Your unit in particular and your reputation for bravery, excellence and unfailing commitment to duty is also unrivalled which also I believe is a sign of the discipline and excellent training that is at the heart of GSU training. I call upon you graduates today to ensure that the GSU flame of excellence continues to burn,” President Uhuru said during his call to the graduates.

Shioso was thus surprised at their behaviour given that the unit exudes one of the highest standards of discipline among the police units.

“I personally took a while to understand why they had done it. This is our premium and the most tactical unit that we rely on because of its discipline. More is expected especially on the unit’s officers, they should be beyond reproach,” he noted.

The video seen by Viral Tea showed the officers filming themselves making insensitive comments in Sheng, particularly war cries seemingly aimed at members of the public, if not their enemies.

NPS issued a statement on the matter later on Wednesday after it sparked uproar across the country, affirming that action would be taken against the officers.

It termed their behaviour as unacceptable to the values of the police force in the country, noting that all its graduands went through rigorous training designed to make them responsible officers to better serve Kenyans.

“Attention of the National Police Service is drawn to a video clip circulating on social media depicting newly graduated General Service Unit (GSU) officers recording themselves as they make some irresponsible and reckless remarks. We wish to clarify and assure the public that the behaviour portrayed in the clip is not acceptable and does not reflect the values of the GSU, Kenya Police Service and the National Police Service.

“All graduands went through a rigorous value-based training modelled on democratic policing principles and designed to make them responsive and responsible officers of the law at the service of citizens. The oath of allegiance they took as part of their graduation is a testament to the sanctity of their duty to serve,” noted the NPS.

headline: Uhuru Gives CBK New Powers Over Digital Loan Apps
author: By Viral Tea Ke

breadcrumbs.name: Uhuru Gives CBK New Powers Over Digital Loan Apps

description: (13) Digital loan apps in Kenya have a period of six months to register with the Central Bank of Kenya (CBK) according to an amendment bill signed by President Uhuru Kenyatta. The President on Tuesday, December 7 at State House, Nairobi assented to the Central Bank of Kenya (Amendment) Bill, Public-Private Partnership Bill, and Trustees • Read More »
articleBody:
Digital loan apps in Kenya have a period of six months to register with the Central Bank of Kenya (CBK) according to an amendment bill signed by President Uhuru Kenyatta.

The President on Tuesday, December 7 at State House, Nairobi assented to the Central Bank of Kenya (Amendment) Bill, Public-Private Partnership Bill, and Trustees (Perpetual Succession) (Amendment) Act, all of 2021.

The amended Central Bank Act, 2021, gives the Central Bank of Kenya powers to license digital lenders in the country as well as ensure the existence of fair and non-discriminatory practices in the credit market.

As a consequence, the Competition Authority of Kenya (CAK) requires digital lenders to provide interest rates, late payment, and rollover fees for their loans before dishing out loans to their customers. Its report revealed that 77 per cent of mobile loan borrowers have been forced to pay penalties and charged to roll over their debts.

Data from the CBK showed that borrowers borrowing digital loans from unregulated lenders rose from 200,000 in 2016 to more than two million in 2019.

The new bill is a huge blow to the digital lenders who have expressed their fearlessness towards regulations.

However, they were sceptical of the government regulating them which might hurt their businesses. Through the Digital Lenders Association, the lenders had started “regulating themselves.”

The CBK in November offered Kenyans a relief by suspending the listing of negative credit information for borrowers with loans below Kenya Shillings (Ksh.) 5 million, whose loans were performing previously, but have become non-performing from October 1, 2021.

Loans below Ksh5 million that fall in arrears from October 1, 2021, to September 30, 2022, will not lead to the “blacklisting” of the borrower on the Credit Reference Bureaus (CRBs). Further, CRBs will not include in any credit report, any negative credit information for loans of a customer less than Ksh5 million submitted to the CRB from October 1, 2020, to September 30, 2021, for a period of 12 months from October 1, 2021, to September 30, 2022

On its part, the new Public-Private Partnerships Act repeals the 2013 legislation by providing an elaborate legal framework to cover both national and county level PPP projects.

Further, the new law expands the role of the private sector in PPP initiatives beyond financing to include construction, operation and maintenance of the projects.

The Trustees (Perpetual Succession) (Amendment) Act, passed by the National Assembly on October 19, 2021, seeks to simplify the registration of trusts by, among other reforms, shifting the administration of the process to the new office of the principal registrar of documents.

headline: New Details On Neo Kenya Mpya Bus Accident Emerge
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: New Details On Neo Kenya Mpya Bus Accident Emerge

description: The accident involved two buses that had ferried the students of Gititu Mixed High School after they closed on Monday, December 13.
articleBody:
New details have emerged that led to the Neo Kenya Mpya bus accident on Tuesday, December 14 in Makuyu, Murang’a County.

Reports by NTV indicated that the accident involved two buses that had ferried the students of Gititu Mixed High School after they closed on Monday, December 13.

The report went on to state that the bus was being driven by a conductor who was not authorised, nor was he qualified to do so.

Eyewitnesses revealed to the media outlet that the two buses were speeding and were closely following each other. The accident occurred when the second bus had tailgated the lead bus that eventually overturned.

“As the bus approached a sharp corner, the driver attempted to slow down to enable him to negotiate the bend. However, the second bus driver, who was closely following him, hit him at the back,” the witness indicated.

The bus lost control and overturned. The driver leapt out of the vehicle on noticing what was happening but died in the process, making him the only reported fatality.

Passers-by had helped to pull the students from the wreckage as rescue teams arrived to rush the students to the medical facilities across the country.

Six of them were treated at Makuyu Sub-county hospital and discharged while another six were treated at Kenol Hospital in Murang’a and also discharged.

One student was however reported to have been admitted with a broken arm while two girls were referred to Thika Level 5 hospital.

Eight students were treated and discharged from Murang’a Level 5 hospital. One was admitted to the facility while another was referred to the Kenyatta National Hospital (KNH).

Meanwhile, the vehicle was towed to the Makuyu Police station.

The Sacco owns buses that ply The Thika Road-City Centre route and has been for long viewed as one of the most notorious saccos in Kenya.

headline: Akothee Welcomes a Bouncing Baby Girl
author: By Linah Mwangi

breadcrumbs.name: Akothee Welcomes a Bouncing Baby Girl

description: Akothee introduced her daughter Elisabeth to the world on Friday evening, December 10 through her social media platforms.
articleBody:
Self-proclaimed President of single mothers Esther Akoth aka Akothee is the newest mother in town.

Akothee introduced her daughter Elisabeth to the world on Friday evening, December 10 through her social media platforms.

She further revealed that another woman had agreed to carry the baby for her. It is not clear if she was adopting the baby or if the woman she thanked in her post was a surrogate.

In the post Akothee also thanked the mother for the child, “My bundle of joy is here. Thank you to the woman who carried my baby. May you be blessed Baby Elisabeth.”

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by AKOTHEE KENYA (@akotheekenya)

In her previous posts, Akothee had mentioned to wanted to have another child, mostly a baby boy as she had even girls in her house.

“I want a boy I have enough of twerkers in my house, Pregnancy comes with lots of challenges especially when you are older all a woman needs is a supportive partner husband tutashugulikia baadaye (we will deal with it later). May God bless all women who are praying to be mothers May God bless your wombs,” she added.

Recently, she promised her lover Nelly Oaks two children.

“I am having two kids for him soon. And if he dumps me or whatever the case, he will also belong to my baby daddy list, I will still give him the same love and respect as the rest who left.

“A friend, a partner and a soul mate,” Akothee said after moving in with him.

headline: DCI Kinoti Counters Arrest Warrant Against Him
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: DCI Kinoti Counters Arrest Warrant Against Him

description: The application filed on the same day the warrant was issued had seen Kinoti accuse businessman Jimmy Wanjigi and his wife Irene Nzisa of harassment.
articleBody:
(4)

Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) boss George Kinoti has fought back against a second arrest warrant issued against him by the High Court on Tuesday, December 14.

The application filed on the same day the warrant was issued had seen Kinoti accuse businessman Jimmy Wanjigi and his wife Irene Nzisa of harassment.

He also placed the couple as well as Inspector General of Police Hillary Mutyambai, Director of Public Prosecutions (DPP) Noordin Haji and Attorney General Paul Kihara as respondents.

“Being an application for stay of execution and/or conservatory order pending the lodging, hearing and determination of the intended appeal against the ruling and orders of the High Court of Kenya at Nairobi [Hon. A.C. Mrima, J] delivered at Nairobi on the 29th of November 2021, in Nairobi High Court Constitutional Petition No. 520 of 2017,” read the application in part.

The detectives boss also revealed that he was subjected to harassment and reached out to the court for a stay order against the arrest warrant.

He remained apprehensive that the continued harassment of himself would continue not unless the court grants the stay orders sought in his application dated November 30, 2021.

“THAT I swear this Affidavit in support of my application dated 30th November 2021. THAT what is stated herein is true to the best of my knowledge save for the matters deposed to on information sources whereof having been disclosed and matters deponed to on belief whereupon the grounds thereof having been given,” he added.

The warrant seen by Viral Tea indicated that Kinoti was pursuant to an order issued by Hon. Justice Mwita on June 21, 2019.

“Therefore you are hereby commanded forthwith to apprehend the said Mr George Maingi Kinoti and to bring him before this court to answer to the said charge and to be further dealt with according to law,” read the warrant in part.

Justice Anthony Mrima had pronounced a four-month jail sentence on Kinoti after he was found by the court to be guilty of contempt after he failed to return a firearm confiscated from businessman and presidential aspirant Jimi Wanjigi.

He gave Kinoti one week to surrender to authorities to commence his sentence period.

“The warrant of apprehension shall be forthwith executed by the Inspector General of Police. If he fails to execute the warrant, the same shall remain valid and be executed at any time including when Kinoti leaves the DCI office,” ruled Mrima.

headline: Frankie Just Gym It, Corazon Welcome Second Child (PHOTO)
author: By Viral Tea Ke

breadcrumbs.name: Frankie Just Gym It, Corazon Welcome Second Child (PHOTO)

description: Kwamboka shared a photo of her holding her newborn in her arms at a hospital on Wednesday, December 8.
articleBody:
Socialite and lawyer Corazon Kwamboka has announced the birth of her baby girl, the s econd child with renowned fitness coach Frankie Kiarie, alias Frankie Just Gym It.

Taking to her Instagram page, Kwamboka shared a photo of her holding her newborn in her arms at a hospital on Wednesday, December 8.

She disclosed that the birth process lasted for only an hour inside the theatre and was subjected to lying on her back with drips for six hours.

She expressed relief on holding her little girl in her arms for the first time and went ahead to name her Koko.

“Zero hours of labour, 1hr 15 mins inside the theatre, and 6 hours of lying on my back with drips and chills, unable to twist or turn, I am finally holding my little girl. Thank you for choosing us to be your parents Koko.

“We can’t wait to show you the world and love you forever,” she wrote.

A week ago, the duo went for an exquisite photoshoot for their unborn baby, with Frankie donning a purple suit and floral shirt and Kwamboka sporting a purple gown, with a touch of black and brown.

She had expressed the excitement of the couple meeting their newborn, wishing her the very best in what they longed, wished and prayed for.

“May you always know that you were longed for, wished for and prayed for my little baby. We can’t wait to meet you,” she wrote.

Kwamboka announced her pregnancy months ago, adding that it was unplanned and thought that breastfeeding would provide her from getting pregnant. Nonetheless, she expressed excitement about her new chapter.

headline: How To Make Your Home Calm Ahead Of Festive Season
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: How To Make Your Home Calm Ahead Of Festive Season

description: A house is a basic need, where one retires to after manhandling the bustling life of the city as well as at work.
articleBody:
The Christmas break is almost upon us and despite the two to three days we may spend with family, the first thing you will go back to when you break for the festive period from your place of work is your home.

A house is a basic need, where one retires to after manhandling the bustling life of the city as well as at work. However, just living in a house is not enough, you need to feel comfortable when you step into your home every evening.

With all the distractions that fill our daily life, from TV, social media, work and everything in between, it can be hard to find your calm space, what is called your zen. The first step is to have a space to come back to at the end of the day that inspires a sense of calm within you.

Viral Tea spoke to Aisha Pandor, CEO of SweepSouth, for some advice on how to easily create a space that is calm, zen and a peaceful retreat for the whole family. She shared the following tips:

Do a big purge

Go through everything that you own and do a big purge of all the things you don’t need. This includes furniture and big items, too.

Have a TV that’s been standing in your house unused? Get rid of it. Have an overabundance of clothes that you don’t wear? Get rid of some. Doing a big purge of things you barely use will already make your home feel more spacious and less cluttered.

Choose your colours wisely

Neutral and natural colours work best for a zen space. Think earthy tones such as grey, white and beige.

You could also add in touches of natural green with plants to add a more nature-like feel to the space. Keep a natural colour palette in mind when you decorate.

Even your furniture should have earthy colours. Your furniture should also ideally be made from natural materials and have clean, clear lines.

As Rumi says: “Life is a balance of holding on and letting go.” Let go of the clutter you don’t need, and hold on to peace and calm.

headline: Hezena Lemaletian: Samburu Queen Who Lit Up Azimio La Umoja
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Hezena Lemaletian: Samburu Queen Who Lit Up Azimio La Umoja

description: The beauty queen stunned the entire crowd with her looks, as she sported a blue dress coupled with Maasai-inspired ornaments
articleBody:
The Azimio La Umoja convention held on Friday, December 10 at the Kasarani stadium in Nairobi had many highlights leading up to the declaration of ODM leader Raila Odinga’s 2022 presidential bid but what caught the eyes of many was one beautiful Samburu woman, the Queen of The North known as Hezena Lemaletian.

The beauty queen stunned the entire crowd with her looks, as she sported a blue dress coupled with Maasai-inspired ornaments but what set them alight was the bold speech she delivered during the event that drew supporters from across the country.

If she was eyeing a political spotlight for several weeks, she got one on Friday when she not only escorted Raila to the podium to deliver his highly anticipated speech but also delivered a thrilling one of her own that left the crowd begging for more from her.

“ Vijana Tibim! Naitwa Hezena Lemaletian, Secretary General of Vijana na Raila.

“Your excellency, the enigma, Baba, the greatest and the most respected man in the North of the Sahara and South of the Limpopo, former Prime Minister and the fifth General, Raila Odinga and her excellency Mama Ida Odinga, all protocols observed, habari zenu (how are you)?” the Vijana na Raila Secretary-General greeted the enthusiastic crowd.

She went ahead to declare that she would contest for the Samburu Woman Representative seat in the upcoming 2022 general elections.

“I am also vying for the woman representative, Samburu county. I’m known as the Queen of the North,” she announced.

She urged the youth to direct their support to the ODM leader, adding that he struggled selflessly to build a better Kenya for its citizens.

“I have a plan for the youth. Baba (Raila) has fought for our free education. Many of us can go to school because of that free education, and it is all thanks to Raila.

“He also fought for our democracy and devolution and we as youth would not be here celebrating today were it not for his struggle for us,” she added.

She advised her audience to take a look at other African countries and how united they are, before urging Kenyans to be patriotic, with Raila being the only solution to a loving nation.

“If you go to other African countries, they have that togetherness. We also want the spirit of patriotism, and the only solution to that is Raila,” she urged, adding the viral quote made by COTU Secretary-General Francis Atwoli “In whose hands are we safe?”

filling the faction with thirsty Kenyan men operating wheelbarrows.

“We don’t want other parties full of thirsty men (Mafisi) and on behalf of the young ladies in this country who are fighting for their own spaces, we have said that we don’t want thirsty men and we shall not be carried by wheelbarrows.

“A wheelbarrow cannot help me as a resident of Samburu,” she tore into Ruto’s party.

Lemaletian first came to the limelight on Tuesday, October 19 when she shared a social media post urging Kenyans to turn up in their huge numbers to register as voters for the 2022 polls. Kenyan men in particular were distracted by her inviting looks and beauty of the Samburu Woman Rep candidate and made their desires known through the comments.

Some netizens had even hinted at relocating to Samburu to vote for her if that could mean winning over the heart of the charming woman.

For the better part of Friday, she rose to an online celebrity, a status that stretched to as early as Saturday, December 11.

Born and raised in Samburu County, she attended Milimani Primary School in Maralal and St. Theresa Girls High School before her exemplary performance in high school saw her earn a place at the University of Nairobi.

Lemaletian is the current Miss Commonwealth Kenya and the first from the North to hold the prestigious crown.

She is also the Global Peace Ambassador, A Goodwill, Culture, and Charity Ambassador for the Commonwealth, a position she has been using to demand better for her Samburu society. She is also the Rift Valley Peace Champion and the founder of Pastoralists Sports Initiative, which uses sports and culture to empower the youth to foster peace and togetherness.

Lemaletian joins a group of women who are now staking their claim in their quest to claim the top positions in next year’s polls. Among them who has been recently winning the hearts of Kenyans during their campaign trails is Media Council of Kenya (MCK) member Patience Nyange.

The patron of the weekly #KenyaWomenSeries is eyeing the Taita Taveta gubernatorial seat next year, seeking to succeed either current Governor Granton Samboja or Woman Representative Lydia Haika.

“My people have asked me to. I am a child of Taita Taveta County and when they tell me what they want me to do for them, I will heed to their call,” she told Viral Tea in an exclusive interview after her announcement on Monday, June 14.

headline: Festus Mutuku: Covid Inspired Me To Start my Tour Company
author: By Bosco Mbugua

breadcrumbs.name: Festus Mutuku: Covid Inspired Me To Start my Tour Company

description: (19) Festus Mutuku is the Founder and Director of Let’s Discover Travel Ltd, a Kenyan Tours and Travel company. He has been running the company for a year and a half, enjoying considerable success and challenges too along the way. He shares his journey with Viral Tea: Tell us about yourself, early childhood, upbringing and • Read More »
articleBody:
Festus Mutuku is the Founder and Director of Let’s Discover Travel Ltd, a Kenyan Tours and Travel company.

He has been running the company for a year and a half, enjoying considerable success and challenges too along the way.

He shares his journey with Viral Tea:

Tell us about yourself, early childhood, upbringing and education

I’m a 27-year-old and most of my childhood in Katangi Village where did my primary school education and later proceeded to Kangaru School in Embu for my High school education. In Campus, I took a Degree in pure and applied statistics which wasn’t a perfect fit because am definitely now your white-color-job type of a guy. I really love travelling and exploring new spaces in the digital world.

What inspired you to start a tour company? How did it all begin for you?

After the Covid-19 pandemic struck, most of us were unlucky to lose our jobs. This gave me enough space to think about so many things. Sincerely speaking, I loved working as a content creator but I didn’t find it sustainable. I started growing an interest in traveling and therefore started posting pictures with the aim to showcase how beautiful Kenya is and then later I though why not turn it into a business, and now here we are.

You share quite some exotic places on your socials, is your target market the high end clientele?

Tricky question, but yes we are a luxury travel company and our niche is the high-end properties. Personally, I think it’s a market space which has been neglected by most travel companies in Kenya. Sometimes it cuts across all target markets but only on case to case basis.

With only 5 luxurious rooms, Elephant Gorge in Amboseli offers the most intimate experience to everyone single traveller. A gem! pic.twitter.com/zmqwPwEmDv

— Let's Discover Travel Ltd (@letsDiscoverke) December 12, 2021

How has business been so far?

Business has been great, I sincerely never thought we would get this far. I definitely enjoy every single day growing this brand. It comes with its own fair of challenges but they make us better each and every day.

What’s the biggest lesson you have picked so far?

As your grow in business, you have to learn and unlearn so many things. Patience in the business curve is something I have learnt to embrace. Gratitude also, being able to take stock of how far to have come gives you the energy to continue working hard. Consistency, had it not been for the consistency we have developed we wouldn’t be where we are now. Persistence, being an entrepreneur in Kenya is not easy so even during the tough times we definitely toughen up.

How would you sum up the tourism industry in Kenya?

Personally, Kenya has so much potential but we really don’t exploit it to the fullest. I really wish the Government could support the sector better. Look at what Rwanda are doing, they are really on the global stage marketing their country with #VisitRwanda, same case in South Africa with #MeetSouthAfrica. If we are able to maximize such opportunities, then we would see a tremendous growth in our industry and that would work to also aid in building our economy because of the foreign exchange that happens in this industry alone.

What would you say has contributed to your quick growth?

Social media and the dedication of our team to convert the enquiries has been key in our steady growth. Also, I have one of the best partners in the business with vast experience in Luxury Travel.

I personally never consider bonfire as our competitors. What we are doing is completely different from what Bonfire are doing. We focus on tailor-made packages while they focus on group travel. The biggest mistake that start-ups make is to enter into a market space to compete with other already established brands instead of building their brands in a specific niche. Don’t get me wrong, I sincerely respect Bonfire and what they do but they are not our competitors in any way.

Do locals really take up these holiday deals?

Yes, local travelers actually take up these holiday deals. What most Kenyans lack is someone to show them value in what they are paying which is exactly what we are doing and 70% of our clients are locals.

Kajiado never disappoints, This is Oltalet Cottages 😍 pic.twitter.com/Fyl5uDrlpl

— Let's Discover Travel Ltd (@letsDiscoverke) December 9, 2021

Biggest challenge you have faced?

Our biggest challenge has been having to compete with companies which focus more on moving sales rather than offering value to travelers. Most travelers will always choose a cheaper deal compared to a deal which offers them value. We are really trying to change this narrative slowly.

Anything else you’d like to clarify?

Always get to know the value you are getting from each travel plan you get from your travel partners. Sometimes the Value outweighs the cost of that specific plan.

headline: Govt Finds Another Ksh102M in University Girl’s Accounts
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Govt Finds Another Ksh102M in University Girl’s Accounts

description: The High Court's anti-corruption division subsequently ordered the freezing of Kago's bank accounts through Justice Esther Maina after the Assets Recovery Agency (ARA) found Ksh102.8 million in her accounts.
articleBody:
The government once again flagged bank accounts that belonged to Tebby Wambuku Kago, a friend to 21-year-old Felesta Nyamathira Njoroge, a university student who stunned the nation after being gifted over Ksh102 million by her Belgian boyfriend.

The High Court’s anti-corruption division subsequently ordered the freezing of Kago’s bank accounts through Justice Esther Maina after the Assets Recovery Agency (ARA) found Ksh102.8 million in her accounts. It further froze another Ksh5 million in Felesta’s other bank accounts, believed to have been sent from the same Belgian.

The agency once again confided to the court that the amounts could be proceeds of crime, as the owners could not convince the agency regarding the source of the money.

ARA said that Kago had received Ksh102.8 million and Ksh37 million on diverse dates between August 10, 2021, and early November 2021.

However, ARA was perplexed on learning that the Ksh37 million gifted to Kago’s account had vanished without a trace, prompting them to seek court orders to have the remaining amount frozen.

“That preservation orders are hereby issued prohibiting the respondents (Wambuku and Nyamathira) and or their representatives, employees, agents, servants or any other persons acting on their behalf from transacting, withdrawing, transferring, dealing in any manner whatsoever in respect to the funds and any profits or benefits derived or accrued from held in the three bank account,” read the court order.

The missing amount was reported to have been sent to friends and relatives of the suspects, a move that was meant to mask them from the hawk eyes of the Central Bank of Kenya (CBK).

According to records presented in court, the amount was sent to Kago’s account by Felesta’s boyfriend, Merc De Mesel, who is a common name amongst the circles of cryptocurrency and investments, having amassed a wealth of huge magnitudes through bitcoins. He had notably deposited Ksh102 million to Felesta’s account in November.

Investigating officer Fredrick Musyoki revealed that Kago had opened her bank account in February 2021 as a self-employed businesswoman but the amount raised a red flag as it did not indicate the business source.

The court was also reliably informed that the authorities had received intelligence of a money-laundering scheme involving two women which was responsible for gifting them the money.

“The two women are suspected to be part of a syndicate involved in a complex money-laundering scheme involving themselves and foreign Nationals and their bank accounts are used as a conduit of complex money laundering,” noted the ARA lawyer.

Felesta’s account has since been frozen for 90 days to allow ARA to establish the source of the Ksh102 million gifted to her.

“An order is hereby issued prohibiting the respondent (Njoroge), her employees, agents, servants or any other persons acting on their behalf from transacting, withdrawing, transferring, and, or dealing in any manner in respect of any profits or benefits derived or accrued from the funds,” directed Justice Esther Maina on November 20, 2021.

However, she filed an application in court seeking for the accounts to be unfrozen, but ARA remained adamant in compelling her to turn over the amount to the government.

The first deposit of Ksh25,803,756 was made on August 4, 2021, after which Ksh25,803,756 was wired the next day. On August 6, 2021, two separate transactions of Ksh25,242,756 and Ksh25,579,356 were made to Nyamathira’s account.

The agency also claimed to have issued summons to Felesta on October 18, 2021, to shed more light on the mysterious transactions but her lawyers wrote back a day later, claiming that the summons were vague and had no legal grounds.

Mesel responded in a video shared on social media that he gifted his 21-year-old girlfriend the Ksh102 million after he followed the right procedures such as filing paperwork with the bank. As soon as the gift streamed into her accounts, detectives from the Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) raided their home, apprehended them and accused him of funding unlawful activities.

He added that the police had raided their home when the girlfriend was heavily pregnant.

headline: Court Orders IG Mutyambai To Arrest DCI Kinoti
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Court Orders IG Mutyambai To Arrest DCI Kinoti

description: Kinoti was charged before the court for contempt of court pursuant to an order issued by Hon. Justice Mwita on June 21, 2019.
articleBody:
The High Court has ordered the Inspector-General of Police Hilary Mutyambai to arrest Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) boss George Kinoti.

An arrest warrant seen by Viral Tea indicated that Kinoti was charged before the court for contempt of court pursuant to an order issued by Hon. Justice Mwita on June 21, 2019.

“Therefore you are hereby commanded forthwith to apprehend the said Mr George Maingi Kinoti and to bring him before this court to answer to the said charge and to be further dealt with according to law,” read the warrant in part.

Justice Anthony Mrima had pronounced a four-month jail sentence on Kinoti after he was found by the court to be guilty of contempt after he failed to return a firearm confiscated from businessman and presidential aspirant Jimi Wanjigi.

pic.twitter.com/LK9TtBvZH3

— Marvin Chege (@marvin_chege10) December 14, 2021

He gave Kinoti one week to surrender to authorities to commence his sentence period.

“The warrant of apprehension shall be forthwith executed by the Inspector General of Police. If he fails to execute the warrant, the same shall remain valid and be executed at any time including when Kinoti leaves the DCI office,” ruled Mrima.

The judge then alleged threats on his life after the sentence, stating that he had received some of them from senior state agents for making unfavourable rulings against the government.

“Recently I handled a matter and issued some orders. The orders were directed towards some senior state officers. I was surprised to be approached by an emissary sent by one of the said state officers,” he recounted.

The sentencing came after Kinoti failed to appear in court physically on Monday, September 27, 2021, after he was summoned by the judge.

Justice Mrima, who was presiding over the case, had ruled that Kinoti was guilty of contempt of court. He subsequently directed the DCI to appear at the High Court on November 18, 2021, for sentencing.

The case involves seven guns that were seized from Wanjigi’s home. In 2019 the High Court had ordered the government to give Wanjigi back his guns, but he never got them back.

Senior Counsel Ahmednasir Abdullahi on Friday, November 19, while giving his opinion on the ruling, took note of Kinoti’s connection with some of the most powerful men in his circles, also given his status amongst the country’s security force.

However, he did warn the DCI boss that failure to honour the court ruling could have serious consequences. To be specific, Kinoti had until Wednesday, November 24 at 6 pm to get stay orders against the sentence from the Court of Appeal or from Justice Anthony Mrima.

“DCI Kinoti is Powerful with Powerful men in his corner. But if he doesn’t get a stay order against the four months prison sentence either from Justice Mrima or the Court of Appeal by 6 PM Wednesday next week, then at 6.01, he stands constructively dismissed from the police force.

“It doesn’t matter whether or not the Inspector-General of Police enforces the court order. For the purposes of his criminal sentence that is immaterial. Once the order of Justice Mrima crystallizes, Kinoti will be a fugitive from the law and will by operation of law stand discharged from the police force,” he warned in his tweet.

headline: Babu Owino Freed After Shooting DJ Evolve
author: By Viral Tea Ke

breadcrumbs.name: Babu Owino Freed After Shooting DJ Evolve

description: The ruling was delivered on Tuesday, December 14 after the court allowed the withdrawal of the case by DJ Evolve.
articleBody:
Embakasi East Member of Parliament Paul Ongili, alias Babu Owino has been set free after he shot Felix Orinda alias DJ Evolve at a club in Kilimani, Nairobi in January 2020.

The ruling was delivered on Tuesday, December 14 after the court allowed the withdrawal of the case by DJ Evolve.

However, the lawmaker will be prosecuted in the second count for behaving in a disorderly manner while carrying a firearm.

Babu’s last involvement with DJ Evolve’s family was when he penned a message of condolence to the members who lost their matriarch Mary Hongo back in September.

Embakasi East MP Babu Owino has been acquitted in the attempted murder case against Felix Orinda(DJ Evolve) after the court allowed the withdrawal of the case by DJ Evolve.
Babu will however be prosecuted in the second count of behaving disorderly while carrying a firearm.

— Ahmed Mohamed ((ASMALi)) (@Asmali77) December 14, 2021

He noted that they had met each other through a difficult situation but had grown very close.

“Mum you were a mother to me, and a friend. We were united through a difficult situation, we had grown so close but God has His own reasons why this had to happen. As a family, we are deeply saddened by your loss. You are forever loved and treasured” he noted in part.

The MP sympathised with DJ Evolve, praying to God to grant him and his family strength during the difficult time.

“We shall continue holding together and ensure your legacy lives on forever. To my friend Felix and your family I cannot begin to imagine what you are going through. May God grant you peace, strength and comfort to go through this difficult moment in your lives.

“Mum You always told us to be strong no matter how big the storm is and to always put God first. Rest In Peace Mum till we meet again,” he added.

Mary Hongo had taken care of his son following the incident where he was shot by the lawmaker following an altercation at B Club, which is located in the Kilimani area.

The court in March 2021 had ordered the disclosure of an out-of-court agreement that was made between the two.

DJ Evolve had applied to withdraw the attempted murder case against Babu Owino after he was charged over the matter.

“Unconditional withdrawal is not appropriate in the circumstances of this case; the parties must come out openly and tell the court what Babu had offered the family,” the magistrate had ruled at the time.

headline: Sarah Hassan Bags Three Honours In Kalasha Awards 2021 (LIST)
author: By Viral Tea Ke

breadcrumbs.name: Sarah Hassan Bags Three Honours In Kalasha Awards 2021 (LIST)

description: She ruled Kenyan film and TV with an iron fist as she took home all the top honours with different productions that were among the best 31 awards slots
articleBody:
(25)

Award-winning actress, film director and producer Sarah Hassan was the queen of Friday night, December 10 after she bagged three awards at the 2021 Kalasha International Awards held in Nairobi.

Hassan won the Best Lead Actress in a Film accolade while her film Just In Time scored big in several categories.

She ruled Kenyan film and TV with an iron fist as she took home all the top honours with different productions that were among the best 31 awards slots during the ceremony which was attended by celebrities and Kenya’s famous personalities.

Her series dubbed Crime and Justice won her the Best Lead Actress in a TV Drama with her Just in Time film producing the Best Lead Actor in a Film, an award that went to actor Mawuli Gavor. Just in Time went on to win the Best Feature Film category.

Hassan took to Instagram to thank all those who realised the concept of her film.

“Yaaayyyy!!! We won, currently on set filming with my dress ready just waiting to be worn and filled with gratitude!! Thank you Wangui Ngunjiri for repping us. Dolapo Adeleke you’re a brilliant mind & thank you to the whole cast & crew for making the Just In Time movie happen,” she wrote in part.

is a romantic-comedy movie directed by Dolapo Adeleke and Sarah Hassan. Celebrated thespians Stycie Waweru, Mawuli Gavor and Pierra Makena form part of the cast members.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by sarah hassan (@hassansarah)

Joe Kinyua, famously known as Njoro wa Uba took home two awards after he was awarded the Best Lead Actor in the TV Drama (Njoro wa Uba) and Best TV drama for Njoro wa Uba.

Actress Catherine Kamau aka Kate actress took home the best supporting actress in Film award and the lifetime achievement award went to Judy Kibinge.

House of Secrets, a film by students of United States International University-Africa (USIU) Michelle Donde and Steph Sevani won three awards; best sound designer going to Kelvin Osoo, best director and best feature by a student.

The Kalasha International Film and TV Awards are held every year in recognition of all the filmmakers in Kenya and was launched 10 years ago.

Here is the full list of Kalasha Awards 2021 winners:

Best Lead Actor in a Film: Mawuli Gavor in Just in Time

Best Lead Actress in a Film: Sarah Hassan in Just in Time

Best Supporting Actor in a Film: John Ndegwa in Kutu

Best Supporting Actress in a Film: Catherine Kamau in Kutu

Best Documentary: Kesho Pia Ni Siku by Ngendo Mukii

Best Lighting Technician: Walter Odhiambo in Adisa

Best Special Effects: Philip Kesenwa and Paul Jackton in Mission to Rescue

Best Special Effects: Philip Kesenwa and Paul Jackton in Mission to Rescue

Best Original Screenplay: Dennis Humprey in Fikirini

Best Feature Film: Just in Time by Sarah Hassan and Dolabo Adelele

Best Director of Photography: Ryan Tenga in Teleport

Best Short Film: Kutu by Peter Wangugi

Best Local Language Film: Fikirini by Dennis Humphrey

Best Director: Michelle Donde and Steph Sevani in House of Secrets

Best Production Designer: Harrison Mutinda in Mission to Rescue

Best Lead Actor in a TV Drama: Joe Kinywa (Njoro) in Njoro wa Uba

Best Lead Actress in a TV Drama: Sarah Hassan (Detective Makena) in Crime and Justice

Kituo Halisi Award: KU TV

Best Performance in a TV Comedy: Frank Kimani (Mr Wang’ombe) in Varshita

Best TV Drama: Njoro wa Uba by Lucy Mwangi

Best Animation: Mondays and Fridays by Shawn Mwendwa

headline: Inside Low-Key Nyashinski, Zia Bett Wedding (PHOTOS)
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Inside Low-Key Nyashinski, Zia Bett Wedding (PHOTOS)

description: The couple exchanged vows before a small group of family and friends in the intimate ceremony.
articleBody:
(25)

Famous Kenyan artist Nyamari Ongegu, alias Nyashinski and his lover, Zia Bett walked down the aisle in a wedding ceremony held on Friday, December 10 in Nairobi away from the cameras.

Despite the two not sharing photos of the wedding held at the Nairobi Chapel church along Ngong Road, photos shared exclusively by Citizen Digital offered a vivid description of how the lush ceremony went down.

Nyashinski was dressed in a stylish, cream brown suit coupled with a black tie while Zia rocked a long, pure white wedding dress holding a bouquet of flowers.

The couple exchanged vows before a small group of family and friends in the intimate ceremony.

“Was a good day with some good ol friends from the hood! Lakini the point is, nani anakaa mdosi hapa? (But who looks like a rich person here?),” legendary artist Nameless offered a glimpse of the wedding to his Instagram followers.

Other notable celebrities who attended the wedding were Nyashinski’s former Kleptomaniax bandmate Collo, DJ Stylez, Big Pin and Wahu. Nyashinski’s best man was his former manager turned movie producer Fakii Liwali and city pastor Robert Burale was the master of ceremony.

The couple walked down the aisle to Zia’s husband’s biggest hit Malaika. Two years ago, the couple held a colourful traditional ceremony in Nandi County where family, close friends and notable celebrities were in attendance.

Zia and Nyashinski have always kept their private lives off the internet, with the former disclosing that at no point will she share photos of her son online.

Nyashinski is among the string of celebrities and media personalities tying the knot in lush weddings, the latest being former Inooro TV presenter Muthoni wa Mukiri, who married her longtime lover Isaac Njoroge in a private ceremony held at the Windsor Country Club on Saturday, November 20.

headline: Twist In Willy Paul, Diana Marua Drama As Weezdom Mentioned
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Twist In Willy Paul, Diana Marua Drama As Weezdom Mentioned

description: Willy Paul on Thursday, December 9 responded with a video of his own, hours after Marua had accused him of allegedly attempting to sexually assault her nearly three years ago.
articleBody:
(25)

The rape saga between Kenyan singer Wilson Abubakar Radido, alias Willy Paul and rapper Diana Marua, alias Diana B took a new angle after the controversial gospel artist exposed former EMB signee Weezdom’s name in his defence.

Willy Paul on Thursday, December 9 responded with a video of his own, hours after Marua had accused him of allegedly attempting to sexually assault her nearly three years ago.

He absolved himself from her accusations, noting that she lied to the public that he attempted to rape her, despite the ideology that she would not believe him.

“I know she won’t believe, but that’s a big lie. I have never raped anyone! Tell your husband (Bahati) the truth.

“Tell him that you slept at my house and something happened at that time. Whatever allegations you have against me are not true and you know that” he affirmed, adding that he only gave her his number and Instagram details.

He likened the relationship between himself and Weezdom to that of brotherhood, thus he revealed to him that he had a one-night stand with Marua.

“I opened up to him and told him that there was a thing that happened between Marua and I but it was less than 24 hours ago. I told him and he was shocked, like two to three months ago, he came out and told me that she had confirmed that it took place and that she had no idea how it happened, so she did not want anyone to know about it,” he narrated, affirming to Marua to stop lying to the public.

However, Weezdom responded in an update on his Instagram post that he would try to settle the issue with Willy Paul in private through friends and family before providing his side of the story.

“I’m aware that I’ve been mentioned severally by Pozze about whatever that is going on. Amidst all the allegations from Diana’s story…Bahati na Willy Paul are True Brothers and both are my friends we’ll try to see if we can settle this privately through Friends and Family.

“If it won’t materialise, the truth shall set the innocent free,” said Weezdom.

Willy Paul on Friday, December 10 released a press statement declaring that he would be suing Marua for defamation and character assassination, adding that Bahati is using his wife to settle his long-standing rivalry with him.

“I am shocked by the false and utter defamatory allegations labelled against me by D, my longtime friend, the same has injured my reputation as a parent, father and public figure.

“The allegations of attempted rape by D are baseless and orchestrated to win public sympathy, D’s crocodile tears have served the purpose and the poor masses are buying to it. I believe B is behind the scenes using the wife to fight his battles,” he faulted the couple in the statement.

View this post on Instagram

A post shared by W.I.L.L.Y.P.O.Z.Z.E (@willy.paul.msafi)

In his defence, he affirmed that he has never sexually assaulted any woman in his life and would never imagine himself doing so.

“I was raised by a woman and I owe my whole career to a woman who held my hand when I was naïve and on diapers in the industry. The women in my life have always been my greatest inspiration some have given me children, whom I treasure more than anything. I cannot and will never assault a woman sexually,” he defended.

Taking to her YouTube channel on Thursday, December 9, a teary Marua narrated how a few years back, Willy Paul had been pursuing her while she was living along Mombasa Road at Great Wall Apartments around the Syokimau area.

Marua recalled how she met the controversial gospel singer at a movie shop while he flirted with her. He had invited her to his house but she turned him down on the basis that she did not know him well.

Willy Paul then lured her into his car as an alternative, locked the doors of the vehicle thus trapping her inside with him before he sped off. He then took Marua to an apartment and invited her to climb up to his house, but she refused and demanded to be dropped back home.

Angered, he tried to force her up into his house and allegedly attempted to assault her sexually.

“ He came on top of me and he started pulling my skirt up …he’s tearing my skirt and my top so I’m like what are you doing, I’m trying to scream and trying to tell him to get off me. So I started screaming, this guy was choking me so that I cannot scream,” she went on.

Willy Paul was taken aback by the screams and moved away from her. Marua saw the move as a chance to escape from the apartment with torn clothes and into the darkness surrounding the murram road until she spotted a boda boda rider who came to her aid.

headline: Natalie Tewa Contracts COVID-19
author: Marvin Chege
description: She shared the news on her Instagram stories on Wednesday, December 8, narrating that contracting the virus was a surprise for her given the precautions she always undertook
articleBody:
Popular YouTube content creator and influencer Natalie Tewa tested positive for COVID-19 and recounted her experience with the virus.

She shared the news on her Instagram stories on Wednesday, December 8, narrating that contracting the virus was a surprise for her given the precautions she always undertook and the fact that she received her two doses of the Moderna vaccine.

Tewa disclosed that she had gone for her birthday party on Friday, December 3 and that the venue was full of people.

“I’ve just tested positive for Covid. I’ve been avoiding Covid for so long, I was literally the Covid police, saying wear your mask, don’t go out.

“Now I went out for my birthday on Friday, and the place was super crowded but of course, you’re already there and having fun,” she explained.

She added that the friends she was in the company with were feeling unwell, which prompted her to get tested for the virus and reported having her first symptoms on Monday, December 6.

“The friends I was with are down, not feeling so well, so I knew I had to test. I got my first symptoms on Monday.

“I was having body aches, feeling feverish, headache, and basically fatigued. The results came in today and I’m positive for Covid, although I am feeling a bit better, just congestion in the nose and coughing which I’m taking medication for,” she recalled.

She added that she had to use a humidifier to help circumnavigate her bad coughs to the point that they reduced and helped her feel better. She was also advised to keep her meals light and wholesome.

headline: Why Switch TV Is Going Off Air
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Why Switch TV Is Going Off Air

description: Switch Media would be launching new and exhilarating services in line with its new strategy aimed at putting priority on the digital space.
articleBody:
Switch TV, under the Kenya Red Cross, is set to cease its on-air broadcast in preparation for its transition to the digital space.

Media group Chairman, Sahil Shah explained in a statement on Friday, December 10 that it was making the move into the audio-visual and digital space in line with its market demands.

The station which has won a lot of favour amongst the youth with its programming and nurturing some of their favourite anchors and stars announced that it would make the shift to keep up with a generation being united by globalisation courtesy of the digital shift.

Shah further announced that Switch Media would be launching new and exhilarating services in line with its new strategy aimed at putting priority on the digital space.

pic.twitter.com/Ctdfevvd4D

— Switch TV Kenya (@switchtvkenya) December 10, 2021

“In consistency with our core philosophy of being responsive to the needs of the youth and with the ambition to become the go-to media platform for the emerging generation, Switch Media has made a conscious decision to build a new strategy around being digital-first.

“In view of this, Switch Media will be launching new and exciting services and products in this expanding digital space. We hope to grow this brand together with the technology that comes with it. We assure our stakeholders of our continued presence and support.” Shah stated.

The announcement comes as mainstream media houses begin embracing the digital-first shift in efforts to keep up with its changing viewership base, which has easier access to the internet and social media platforms to keep themselves updated with what goes on across the country.

Nation Media Group in 2020 launched a new digital brand, Nation.Africa, and strengthened its print and broadcast media products through refurbished content to retain and attract more readers.

The charges under its paywall, a first in Kenya, were discounted at 50% for the first six months and began from Ksh10 per day to Ksh750 per year. A change of fortunes in its business model saw the media house balance between a metered and hard paywall.

Following in its footsteps is Standard Media Group which added the launch of its multi-million converged newsroom in line with its digital-first approach and Citizen TV which recently launched its refreshed Citizen Digital platform and launched its brand citizen.digital.

Under the tagline ‘Stories You’ll Love’, the website offers the latest in viral news from entertainment to politics to sports among others.

One of its feature projects dubbed the #KenyaWomenSeries was picked for an international award. The patrons, Media Council of Kenya (MCK) board member Patience Nyange and editor Esther Kiragu held an exclusive gala dinner on December 4, 2021, where the 52 women who were profiled for the whole year were recognised alongside the media houses who shared their stories and were awarded gift packs.

headline: I’m Leaving Radio In 2022- Maina Kageni
author: By Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: I’m Leaving Radio In 2022- Maina Kageni

description: He revealed during his breakfast show on Thursday, December 9 that he will hang his radio shoes to focus on steering operations of his private business.
articleBody:
Classic 105 FM presenter Maina Kageni has announced that he will retire from his lucrative job in 2022, having dominated the airwaves for many years.

He revealed during his breakfast show on Thursday, December 9 that he will hang his radio shoes to focus on steering operations of his private business.

Revealing to his co-host Mwalimu King’ang’i, who also serves as comedian Churchill (Daniel Ndambuki) and they host the popular show Maina and King’ang’i, he unveiled plans to relocate to the United States (US) to start a club in the popular city of Miami, Florida.

“Come next year I am done. I will be retiring from this radio job, I plan on running a club in Miami,” he declared.

When questioned by King’ang’i where he will be staying, Kageni disclosed that he had already purchased a house there, thus settling in would be much easier.

“I will be living in my condor. I bought it Kitambo. I thought we talked about this…,” he replied.

Kageni has been ruling the airwaves for many years, with his voice the main point of attraction to his millions of listeners countrywide who tune in to his conversations every morning.

He has been covering some of the most popular topics in Kenya; from relationships to current affairs and has won the hearts of many Kenyan women.

So precious are his vocals that on Friday, June 11, he revealed that he had insured his voice for Ksh100 million, catching King’ang’i by surprise after he joked about Kageni’s career coming to an end in the event he lost his voice.

“You haven’t insured yours? Mine is insured for Ksh100 million,” Kageni said while laughing at King’ang’is jokes on the show.

The media personality, whom many have come to love and admire, has on previous interviews disclosed that he landed his first radio job by luck.

In 1996, he had returned to Kenya from the UK when he approached Capital FM looking to advertise a product. On reaching the station, he was asked for Ksh40,000 for the voice over and since he did not have the money, he said he would do it.

The bosses at Capital FM loved his voice and that ignited his radio career. A few months into working at Capital, he was recruited by Nation and later by Radio Africa where his salary witnessed a rise by three times.

Two weeks ago Kageni addressed rumours that he might be eyeing a political seat. He, however, announced that he has absolutely no interest in joining politics, adding that one needs to be a political party subject to survive in the Kenyan political scene.

However it is not the same case with many radio presenters who announced they would quit their roles to focus on political seats in 2022, the latest being comedian Felix Odiwour, alias Jalang’o who hosts the Kiss 100 breakfast show and Alex Mwakideu of Milele FM.

headline: List Of Changes Announced At Standard Media Group
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: List Of Changes Announced At Standard Media Group

description: Editor-in-Chief Ochieng Rapuro announced the changes on Thursday, December 9 in a bid to streamline operations at the Mombasa Road-based media house
articleBody:
The Standard Media Group (SMG) has announced a wave of changes following the launch of its multi-million shilling converged newsroom and rebranding of its TV station KTN News.

SMG Editor-in-Chief Ochieng Rapuro announced the changes on Thursday, December 9 in a bid to streamline operations at the Mombasa Road-based media house, eight months since the launch of its converged newsroom.

“We now have a fairly clear picture of what is working for us and what we can do better,” he revealed in a communication sent to its editorial team.

Three senior appointments have been included in the changes. Kizito Namulanda was promoted to Editor in charge of Innovation and Content while Nzau Musau was elevated to Intake Editor. Ng’ang’a Mbugua is a newcomer to the Standard Editorial team having joined as its Deputy Editor for its daily print newspaper.

Namulanda had worked as the Project Manager of the Standard Group transformation project and had a stint as the pioneer Intake Editor. His new role will see him take charge of all of SMG’s broadcast platforms, both TV and Radio.

Musau meanwhile brings on board his long-serving experience in news gathering and processing to his new role, having worked as one of the pioneer continuity editors in the brand new newsroom.

Ng’ang’a Mbugua joined as SMG’s Deputy Editor having come from his role as senior editor at the Nation Media Group’s daily newspaper.

KTN News anchor Sophia Wanuna resumes her role as the Deputy Editor, Broadcast, having served as the acting Broadcast Editor during the rebranding of the 24-hour news channel.

Musau will be replaced by former TV programmes editor John Mwaura as Continuity Editor, while former politics editor Roselyn Obala becomes the new City Editor.

News anchor Fred Indimuli, who had left KBC for a stint at KTN, is the new Politics Editor having served as an Output Editor. Meanwhile, Stevens Muendo was appointed as the new Entertainment Editor in place of Wairimu Nyingi who was moved to the Quality Assurance Desk as an Editor.

Former City Editor Amos Kareithi is the new Deputy Editor for Politics while seasoned Education reporter Augustine Oduor was promoted to the Deputy Editor in charge of City Desk. Eddy Talam was announced as the Deputy Editor in charge of counties. Mark Oloo and Nicholas Asego join up as Quality Assurance Editors at the Print Hub.

The converged newsroom brings together the different divisions in the media house to one giant platform.

The modern superstructure has a central command dubbed the ‘Super Desk’ which is a collage of editors that decide on the various interests of the platforms. Revealed during its launch is a bell at the centre which is rung whenever a breaking news event is involved.

“We have the super desk as well as the intake team that brings the stories that interact with news sources and the news processors at the top (output).

“What we have on the third floor is a loft area for the launch of books and we’re going to host events,” Kipkoech Tanui, SMG’s head of news, explained.

headline: Ex-NTV Journalist Hired By BBC
author: By Viral Tea Ke
description: Osweta expressed his joy at being included in the BBC team, which has a bureau in Nairobi.
articleBody:
The British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) has raided the Nation Media Group (NMG) yet again, this time bringing on board journalist Brian Osweta to the international media house.

Taking to his social media on Wednesday, December 8, Osweta expressed his joy at being included in the BBC team, which has a bureau in Nairobi.

He shared a photo of himself at his new workplace, posing next to the iconic wall of arts encompassing its BBC’s logo which features pictures of some of the most significant African stories ever told.

“His Grace has, is and will always be sufficient for me. Thank you, Jesus! You deserve all the glory. Truly it has been a year of Great Expansion,” he wrote.

Osweta left NMG on December 6, 2021, through a social media post, thanking the media house for according him the opportunity to express his skills as a data journalist for one year.

“I am extremely grateful to @NationAfrica #NationNewsplex for all the opportunities, and growth I have experienced during my time here (it truly is one of the best training grounds for journalists). Today,1 year later, I leave well equipped and prepared to face my next assignment,” he wrote on Twitter.

Osweta helped in steering the data journalism desk to its full potential, with the Nation Newsplex feature detailing in colour and informative data regarding the biggest stories in Africa and around the world.

He will be excited to find out that several of the journalists who joined BBC from Nation Media have gone on to become international icons in the media space, the last one in recent memory being Larry Madowo who is now attached to CNN.

Osweta follows Victor Kiprop, who joined BBC after leaving the media house’s TV station, NTV. He will serve as its Business Journalist, coincidentally, following the same curve Madowo took.

It's not coincidence and it's not luck
I know it comes from above. 🎶🙏🏿🙏🏿

— Victor Kiprop (@VictorKiprop_) December 7, 2021

The business news anchor has been at NTV for the past three years and spent his last ten months co-hosting Your World on the station.

“This also happens to be my last show here on NTV, yes, you heard me right, and I must say it feels like yesterday when I went on air and I have been here for the last three years, co-hosting Your world for the last ten months. This has been a dream come true for me,” he announced.

Kiprop graduated with a Degree in Bachelor of Commerce from Egerton university in 2015. He joined CNBC Africa as a business reporter trainee for five months in 2017.

He recently married his long-time girlfriend Lillian Skyler in a colourful traditional wedding.

headline: Nyashinski Dismisses Imposter Fooling Kenyans Into Sharing Phone Numbers
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Nyashinski Dismisses Imposter Fooling Kenyans Into Sharing Phone Numbers

description: The user who had posed as the Malaika hitmaker had put out a tweet on Monday night, December 13 urging Kenyans to share their phone numbers to receive a small amount of money into their mobile money accounts
articleBody:
Famous Kenyan artist Nyamari Ongegu, alias Nyashinski responded on Tuesday morning, December 14 to a catfish account that had convinced hundreds of Kenyans On Twitter (KOT) to share their personal details to receive money.

The user who had posed as the Malaika hitmaker had put out a tweet on Monday night, December 13 urging Kenyans to share their phone numbers to receive a small amount of money into their mobile money accounts ahead of the festive season.

Hundreds of KOT could not resist the urge to respond with their authentic phone numbers without checking to see whether the tweet was from Nyashinski’s real account or not.

The fake account had also included an email address as well as made a near-copy of the artist’s bio to trick promoters to reach out to him for performances.

Viral Tea can now establish that the account in question is fake. Additionally, spot checks on the two accounts show inconsistency in terms of posting by the catfish account, which gained above 20,400 followers by the time of publication.

In contrast, Nyashinski’s real account has over 124,900 followers.

“This is NOT Me. Please stop sending money!” read his response to the fake account.

The artist had previously appealed to Twitter to verify him for distinction after the same account attempted to trick Kenyans again, taking advantage of the fact that he is rarely seen on social media. He additionally likes to keep his private life off the public eye, and sources say he is hard to reach as he is around his phone on few occasions.

Nyashinski had recently tied the knot to his wife, Zia Bett, in a wedding ceremony held on Friday, December 10 in Nairobi away from the cameras. Despite the two not sharing photos of the wedding held at the Nairobi Chapel church along Ngong Road, photos shared exclusively by Citizen Digital offered a vivid description of how the lush ceremony went down.

The couple walked down the aisle to Zia’s husband’s biggest hit Malaika. Two years ago, the couple held a colourful traditional ceremony in Nandi County where family, close friends and notable celebrities were in attendance.

Many online shopping platforms are gearing up for what will be one of the highest activities every year as Kenyans splash their cash on various household items to prepare for the Christmas period.

headline: Lynn Ngugi Recognised By BBC
author: Marvin Chege
description: She added that Tuesday, December 7 is a day she will never forget as she was feted alongside personalities she looked up to.
articleBody:
Media personality Lynn Ngugi had her Christmas gift presented to her ahead of the festive period in form of recognition amongst the 100 most inspiring and influential women around the world by the British Broadcasting Corporation (BBC) for 2021.

The former producer a nd host for Tuko Talks, which is a subsidiary of the online news website TUKO, took to social media to celebrate the honour of being named amongst the world’s most recognised figures.

She added that Tuesday, December 7 is a day she will never forget as she was feted alongside personalities she looked up to. In addition, she responded to a query regarding the nature of her role as a human interest journalist who has since propelled her YouTube channel to great heights.

“Not sure I will ever get over this day. A few days ago, someone asked me why I love doing what I do, and I proudly replied, “because my work offers me the ability to tell our own stories in an authentic manner and with no shame.

“Today was amazing (still) I hope we can all be inspired, reset our minds and help reinvent the society together. Also, seeing myself next to Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie was in itself a dream come true. Thank you so much, God and the entire team at BBC for this. Together, we will change the world,” she shared.

Ngugi added that the milestone came to her in an unexpected fashion and went on to thank everyone who has been cheering her on as she progresses in her career.

“I am not even going to lie right now, I never thought I would be in this category. How? I mean, who would have thought I would one day be acknowledged among other 99 influential women globally?

“To God be the glory Thank you, @bbcworldservice team, for this,” she shared on social media.
