headline: Clarity On Subaru Forester Used To Kidnap Ethiopian Businessman
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Clarity On Subaru Forester Used To Kidnap Ethiopian Businessman

description: (15) Footage that surfaced on the incident on Sunday, November 21 which went viral on social media showed the businessman, Samson Teklemichael, being picked up by security officers from his vehicle in Nairobi’s Kilimani Estate. New details surfaced on Wednesday, November 24 regarding a Subaru Forester which was used to allegedly kidnap an Ethiopian businessman in broad • Read More »
articleBody:
Footage that surfaced on the incident on Sunday, November 21 which went viral on social media showed the businessman, Samson Teklemichael, being picked up by security officers from his vehicle in Nairobi’s Kilimani Estate.

New details surfaced on Wednesday, November 24 regarding a Subaru Forester which was used to allegedly kidnap an Ethiopian businessman in broad Nairobi daylight by people believed to be security officers.

Footage that surfaced on the incident on Sunday, November 21 which went viral on social media showed the businessman, Samson Teklemichael, being picked up by security officers from his vehicle in Nairobi’s Kilimani Estate.

Teklemichael was bundled into the waiting Subaru which had blocked his Bentley Bentayga in the middle of the road. The four men had thrust him into the vehicle after they approached his Bentley and dragged him out.

The Subaru Forester alleged to have been used to abduct Ethiopian Samson Teklemichael. /TWITTER.BABU OWINO

The white Subaru’s plates read KCD 445K. However, Viral Tea has established that the number plate is fake.

Information via the National Transport and Safety Authority (NTSA) portal where vehicles owners and plates are stored revealed that the plate belongs to a lorry and not the Subaru.

The lorry is white in colour and was manufactured in 2014 before it was registered on June 3, 2015. It has only had two owners being a commercial bank and an individual.

The discovery makes the ordeal more complex as it is still not clear who kidnapped the businessman. Additionally, netizens had pointed fingers at security agencies for being behind the abduction as they notably drive around the city in the Subaru vehicles, some with Government of Kenya (GK) number plates, but the agencies did not issue a statement by the time of publication.

Teklemichael, who is reported to have last been seen on Friday, November 19, could be heard pleading with witnesses to record his abduction. He is said to have made a call to his wife, Milen Mezgebo, notifying them of the unfortunate events, minutes after he was captured.

“He called me and told me that he’s been abducted by someone he does not know. After that, the phone got disconnected and he’s been offline since,” Mezgebo told Citizen TV.

The abductors left his Bentley parked in the middle of a major road in Kileleshwa before his wife was alerted by a friend to go and pick up the vehicle. She took the car and reported the matter at the Kilimani Police Station.

“Police said they are investigating and they are still not getting anything. If they are not getting anything, that means we are not safe,” she lamented.

Mezgebo also revealed that she has also reported the matter to the Ethiopian Embassy in Kenya. She added that her husband is a reputable businessman who exports gas cylinders to Ethiopia and had not expressed fears over his life.

Kilimani police boss Andrew Muturi confirmed that the matter is being investigated by the Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) detectives at the station.

The incident adds to the growing list of businessmen kidnapped in the recent past across Nairobi under unclear circumstances as investigations into the cases remain unresolved.

headline: Driver Dies, Students Injured After Kenya Mpya Bus Overturns (PHOTOS)
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Driver Dies, Students Injured After Kenya Mpya Bus Overturns (PHOTOS)

description: Several students of Gititu Boys High School in Murang'a County suffered injuries.
articleBody:
A driver died after a bus he was driving belonging to Neo Kenya Mpya overturned on Tuesday, December 14.

Makuyu police boss Alexander Shikondi confirmed the incident which took place at Kirimiri area on Makuyu-Ithanga Road

He added that several students of Gititu Boys High School in Murang’a County suffered injuries. They are being treated at Kenol, Makuyu Level 3 and Thika Level 5 hospitals.

Six of them were treated at Makuyu Sub-county hospital and discharged while another six were treated at Kenol Hospital in Murang’a and also discharged.

One student is however reported to have been admitted with a broken arm while two girls were referred to Thika Level 5 hospital.

Eight students were treated and discharged from Murang’a Level 5 hospital. One was admitted to the facility while another was referred to the Kenyatta National Hospital (KNH).

Police reported that the driver lost control of the bus at a sharp corner and eventually overturned.

Passers-by had helped to pull the students from the wreckage as rescue teams arrived to rush the students to the medical facilities across the country.

Meanwhile, the vehicle was towed to the Makuyu Police station.

The Sacco owns buses that ply The Thika Road-City Centre route and has been for long viewed as one of the most notorious saccos in Kenya.

Their drivers are known to ignore traffic rules as they drive down the highways and roads with reckless speeds with their owners said to be untouchable.

headline: Court Freezes CS Kagwe’s No Vaccine No Service Order
author: By Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Court Freezes CS Kagwe’s No Vaccine No Service Order

description: The directive would have seen Kenyans failing to take COVID-19 vaccines barred from accessing basic services including public transport from that date.
articleBody:
The High Court has issued a conservatory order which suspends the government’s directive to unvaccinated Kenyans that they will not access their services come December 21, 2021.

Justice Anthony Mrima issued the order after the contentious matter was lodged in court by Nairobi Lawyer Harrison Kinyanjui, according to details from sources who spoke to Viral Tea.

The order will be in force pending the determination as well as a hearing of the petition.

The directive would have seen Kenyans failing to take COVID-19 vaccines barred from accessing basic services including public transport from that date.

Speaking during a media briefing on Sunday, November 21, Health CS Mutahi Kagwe in the company of his Tourism and Wildlife counterpart Najib Balala also announced that unvaccinated Kenyans would also be barred from hotels.

As part of a campaign to get more Kenyans to be vaccinated against COVID-19, Kagwe also announced that the government would also deny key services to those Kenyans including those offered by the Kenya Revenue Authority (KRA), National Transport and Safety Authority (NTSA).

Before the court ruling was even declared, two entities namely the Federation of Kenya Employers (FKE) and Yaya Centre shopping mall in Kilimani, Nairobi had issued separate statements to Kenyans urging compliance to the directive.

Yaya Centre, in their statement seen by Viral Tea, had indicated that shoppers intent on accessing the mall should show proof of vaccination at its entrances to access several of its shops that serve more than 50 customers each day

It added that signage would be put up communicating the government’s directives as well as the deployment of additional guards to facilitate the exercises.

The directive, they added, would apply to tenants, staff, customers, suppliers and contractors, adding that “we urge you to kindly assist us to ensure that the mall complies with the above government directives to facilitate ease of access especially during this busy festive season.”

FKE directed a similar order to be enforced, but this time by all small and medium-size businesses countrywide, with businesses serving more than 50 employers required to put up signs indicating that they require proof of vaccination from their customers before accessing the premises.

headline: Family Of DP Ruto’s Chief of Staff, the late Osinde Speaks
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Family Of DP Ruto’s Chief of Staff, the late Osinde Speaks

description: Osinde passed away at the Nairobi Hospital on Friday after he was taken ill on Tuesday, December 7.
articleBody:
The family of Ken Osinde, Deputy President William Ruto’s Chief of Staff has issued a statement following his death on Friday, December 10.

The statement revealed that Osinde passed away at the Nairobi Hospital on Friday after he was taken ill on Tuesday, December 7.

He was admitted to the hospital a day later where he underwent emergency surgery before being admitted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

“He unfortunately passed away on Friday, December 10, 2021,” read the statement in part.

The family sent their appreciations to the entire team at Nairobi Hospital for their speedy response and tireless efforts during the period that Osinde was under their care.

“The funeral arrangements will be announced by the funeral organizing committee in due course,” added the statement.

The family also requested for the avoidance of speculation on the cause of his death as well as privacy during the trying period.

DP Ruto mourned the late Osinde as a good leader with robust management as well as good problem solving skills.

“As our Chief of Staff, he was hardworking, diligent, broad thinker and a master of human resources. We will miss his wise counsel and team spirit.

“My heartfelt thoughts and prayers to the family, colleagues and friends. Rest In Peace my friend, Ken,” he wrote on social media.
articleBodyHtml:
The family of Ken Osinde, Deputy President William Ruto’s Chief of Staff has issued a statement following his death on Friday, December 10.

The statement revealed that Osinde passed away at the Nairobi Hospital on Friday after he was taken ill on Tuesday, December 7.

He was admitted to the hospital a day later where he underwent emergency surgery before being admitted to the Intensive Care Unit (ICU).

“He unfortunately passed away on Friday, December 10, 2021,” read the statement in part.

The family sent their appreciations to the entire team at Nairobi Hospital for their speedy response and tireless efforts during the period that Osinde was under their care.

“The funeral arrangements will be announced by the funeral organizing committee in due course,” added the statement.

The family also requested for the avoidance of speculation on the cause of his death as well as privacy during the trying period.

DP Ruto mourned the late Osinde as a good leader with robust management as well as good problem solving skills.

“As our Chief of Staff, he was hardworking, diligent, broad thinker and a master of human resources. We will miss his wise counsel and team spirit.

“My heartfelt thoughts and prayers to the family, colleagues and friends. Rest In Peace my friend, Ken,” he wrote on social media.

headline: Thug Kills Accomplice In Failed Robbery Attempt
author: By Viral Tea Ke

breadcrumbs.name: Thug Kills Accomplice In Failed Robbery Attempt

description: The thugs armed with crude weapons had gained access to David Engineering company in the sub-county and encountered the firm’s guard, Ondieki.
articleBody:
A suspected robber killed his accomplice in a botched robbery attempt at an engineering company, in Mukuru kwa Reuben, Makadara, Nairobi County on Tuesday morning, December 14.

The Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) reported that the thugs armed with crude weapons had gained access to David Engineering company in the sub-county and encountered the firm’s guard, Ondieki.

This is after they scaled the firm’s perimeter wall and leapt inside.

The security guard who had initially noticed two dark silhouettes jump over the perimeter issued a warning against any further movement but the defiant thugs had advanced towards him.

A struggle between the three ensued and in a classic case of the hunter becoming the hunted, one of the thugs attempted to stab Ondieki using a knife but he dashed down and the knife went straight to one of his accomplice’s eyes, killing him on the spot.

Shocked by the sudden turn of events, the knife-wielding assailant immediately dropped his killer weapon and fled the scene, as Ondieki gave a spirited chase.

“In an inspiring story of a brave guard who faced off with armed assailants, Ondieki who is currently receiving treatment for minor injuries enters into our roll of honour as a fearless protector of life and property,” the DCI commended his actions.

Meanwhile, crime scene detectives processed the scene and recovered the murder weapon, which will provide crucial leads into the identity of the stray assailant.

The DCI honoured Ondieki for his bravery and will be celebrating the upcoming Christmas festivities with him & his family, to encourage him and other guards to continue doing good.

headline: DCI Detective Wounded In Shootout Outside Supermarket
author: By Viral Tea Ke

breadcrumbs.name: DCI Detective Wounded In Shootout Outside Supermarket

description: The thugs who were armed with a Ceska pistol loaded with 5 rounds of 9mm caliber, opened fire at the detectives after they declined an order to surrender.
articleBody:
Two armed gangsters were killed by special agents from the Directorate of Criminal Investigations (DCI) on Tuesday morning, December 14, as they attempted to commit a robbery at a supermarket in Ruaka, Kiambu County.

In the detectives’ report filed on Tuesday, the thugs who were armed with a Ceska pistol loaded with 5 rounds of 9mm caliber, opened fire at the detectives after they declined an order to surrender.

However, the sleuths from the Special Service Unit (SSU) responded with gunfire of their own and killed the armed criminals on the spot.

“What followed was a deafening hail of fire, as the detectives drawn from the elite Special Service Unit responded with finality, killing the gun-toting thugs on the spot. Seven spent cartridges were recovered from the scene,” the statement read in part.

The shootout, unfortunately, saw the detective leading the onslaught suffering a bullet injury in the fierce exchange of fire that brought the business in the busy town to a standstill.

However, the injury on his left shoulder did not stop him from leading his men in executing the mission successfully.

The detectives were acting on information received via its anonymous hotline, to the effect that the gang was planning to stage a robbery at a certain supermarket in Ruaka, as it opened its doors for business after the long weekend.

Detectives from the Crime Research and Intelligence Bureau (CRIB) have since established that the slain thugs were part of a larger network of thugs, responsible for robberies targeting supermarkets in various parts of Nairobi and Kiambu counties.

The two were linked to a recent robbery staged at a supermarket in Ngara, where they left with an unspecified amount of money at gunpoint.

“Preliminary findings from our ballistic experts have also linked the recovered firearm to various robberies that have occurred in the city,” they added.

A third suspect who was watching the onslaught from the periphery, took off before the detectives turned towards his direction. He had parked his getaway motorbike at a safe distance, waiting for his accomplices to return with a stash of money.

Instead, he watched in dismay as his accomplices engaged the sleuths in an unsuccessful exchange of fire before he took off towards the eastern bypass.

Meanwhile, the lead detective who took a bullet in the protection of life and property is currently recuperating at a city hospital in stable condition.

The DCI assured Kenyans that it was on high alert for any criminal acts across the country, particularly ahead of the festive season.

“Today’s early morning operation should serve as a warning to criminals that the Directorate of Criminal Investigations remains on high alert, ready to neutralize any criminal activity, especially during this festive season,” the detectives warned.

headline: Students Walk Out Of National School After Burning Domitory (VIDEO)
author: By Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Students Walk Out Of National School After Burning Domitory (VIDEO)

description: The fire broke out on Sunday night, December 12, consuming a dormitory with a capacity of 480 students.
articleBody:
Students from Ikuu Boys High School in Tharaka Nithi County were seen in photos seen by Viral Tea walking out of the premises as the institution was closed indefinitely following a fire.

The school’s principal, Joseph Mbae, stated that the fire broke out on Sunday night, December 12, consuming a dormitory with a capacity of 480 students.

Mbae added that 35 students were arrested by police after they were alleged to have masterminded the fire incident. They were taken to Chuka Police Station for questioning.

He revealed that 243 students had ran out of the school during the commotion and although they were not fully accounted for by the institution, there were no reported injuries as of Monday, December 13.

Mbae narrated that Sunday saw the students retire to the dormitory after evening preps at 10 pm, before he took notice of a group of students via CCTV footage outside the dormitories. He rushed there to find them breaking window panes.

The principal, with the aid of the night guards and other teachers had tried to contain the students but the learners had overpowered them, forcing them to call police in the area for reinforcement

He blamed the police for the delayed response, and had to drive to the station which was six kilometres away to get them. By the time they arrived, three dormitories were already on fire.

Firefighters from Tharaka Nithi County were on scene to put out the inferno before it could burn down a fourth dormitory.

“When the police started shooting in the air to disperse the rioting students, about 243 of the total 1,030 walked out of the school and spent the rest of the night in the bushes, though some returned in the morning,” Mbae told the Nation.

The school’s board closed the institution indefinitely and asked parents of the students to pick them up.

The students had revealed that they were protesting harassment by the prefects as well as the administration.

headline: Uganda To Ban Products From Kenya
author: By Viral Tea Ke

breadcrumbs.name: Uganda To Ban Products From Kenya

description: It is a retaliatory move that follows that of Kenya which had continued its ban on some of her farm produce.
articleBody:
Uganda has begun the process of identifying the raw and processed agricultural products from Kenya before imposing a ban on them from heading into their markets

It is a retaliatory move that follows that of Kenya which had continued its ban on some of her farm produce.

Speaking to journalists on Tuesday, December 14, Ugandan Minister for East African Affairs, Rebecca Kadaga directed the Ministry under President Yoweri Museveni’s government to identify and list the Kenyan products that will be banned by its government “in a short time.”

The government had agreed to a proposal that was nearing its second year to bar goods from Kenya following a meeting held on Monday, December 13.

“We have been too patient. In the past, we have not reciprocated, but now we are going to. This has gone on for too long and within a short time they too will understand what we are going through,” Kadaga fired.

The current decision serves to intensify the trade squabbles between the two nations that began as far back as December 2019.

Kenya had at that time imposed a ban on the import of Ugandan milk, whose brand had shot to national fame and left traders ruing losses with the directive.

In July 2020, Kenya placed another ban on a Ugandan product, this time going for its sugar, against an agreement that would have seen the increase of Uganda’s sugar exports to Kenya.

It then went for its poultry, with players from the industry in Uganda petitioning the government over Kenya’s ban on the products which has raged on for one year now.

Kenya had argued that it was protecting its domestic market, thus some of the products were deemed substandard.

The ban could have devastating effects on the businesses between the two countries as they enjoy a healthy relationship on the business front. Kenya’s exports to Uganda for instance amounted to Ksh75 billion while the reverse was Uganda’s exports to Kenya during the same period hitting Ksh52 billion.

Uganda in response to the ban of imports of milk to Kenya chose Zambia as its alternate option and secured annual supplies of its milk to Zambia following major losses.

Zambia had barred Kenyan milk from entering its market 13 years ago and Nairobi has been frantically trying to reverse it.

Uganda in July snubbed Kenya’s port of Mombasa for its oil business and partnered with Tanzania.

headline: COVID-19: Kenya Records First Three Omicron Variant Cases
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: COVID-19: Kenya Records First Three Omicron Variant Cases

description: Health CS Mutahi Kagwe confirmed on Wednesday, December 15 of the variant which is one of SARS-CoV-2 which causes COVID-19.
articleBody:
(4)

Kenya has recorded the first three cases of the Omicron COVID-19 variant from travellers coming into the country.

Health CS Mutahi Kagwe confirmed on Wednesday, December 15 of the detection of the variant which is one of SARS-CoV-2 which causes COVID-19, while addressing the Council of Governors in Mombasa.

He warned that it would be a variant that will be dominant across the world, adding that he was engaging South Africa on the matter, a variant that is spreading very fast.

“We have detected the Omicron virus among the travellers and it will be dominant across the globe,” he said.

A day earlier, CS Kagwe had dismissed concerns about the presence of the new variant in Kenya after the COVID-19 positivity rate climbed to 11.5 per cent, with 331 people testing positive for the virus in the last 24 hours from a sample size of 2,872, as of Tuesday, December 14.

“We do not have anyone hospitalised with the Omicron variant. We are hoping that either it is a strain that is very mild or it is something that we are going to overcome easily,” he told the media during the briefing.

He added that there is no need for a lockdown if many Kenyans turn up to get the COVID-19 vaccine.

The new variant, identified as B.1.1.529 was on Friday, November 26 declared a variant of concern by the World Health Organization (WHO) and assigned it the name Omicron.

Travellers arriving in Kenya from southern African countries had to undergo COVID-19 tests as Kenya stepped up surveillance at points of entry following reports of the new variant.

The government had initially expressed no immediate plans to ban international flights following the discovery of Omicron. According to Health Principal Secretary (PS) Susan Mochache, the government heightened surveillance in all entry points across the country to monitor the spread of the new variant.

Speaking on Sunday, November 28 at Nyaura Primary School in Kisii County, the PS stated that the country’s economy should be kept running during the COVID-19 pandemic and also urged Kenyans not to panic.

“As a government, we are fully committed, ready and prepared; our borders and airports have been secured with screening being improved,” PS Health Susan Mochache said.

headline: Kenya To Deploy Police Officers To 2022 FIFA World Cup
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Kenya To Deploy Police Officers To 2022 FIFA World Cup

description: Interior Cabinet Secretary (CS) Dr Fred Matiang'i had on Friday, December 10 in Nairobi hosted his Qatari counterpart and Prime Minister, Sheikh Khalid bin Khalifa bin Abdulaziz Al-Thani
articleBody:
Kenya Police officers are set to be posted to Doha, Qatar as part of a security detail that will help secure an influx of fans around the globe for the 2022 FIFA World Cup.

Interior Cabinet Secretary (CS) Dr Fred Matiang’i had on Friday, December 10 in Nairobi made the remarks in the presence of Qatari counterpart and Prime Minister, Sheikh Khalid bin Khalifa bin Abdulaziz Al-Thani where the deployment was one of the plans they had discussed.

The CS spoke during the celebrations to mark Qatar National Day that was hosted by the Qatari Ambassador to Kenya H.E. Jabor bin Ali Al-Dosari.

“Kenya and Qatar are in talks for the deployment of Kenyan security agencies to support Doha during the 2022 FIFA World Cup. The Ministry of Interior and H.E. Sheikh Khalid bin Khalifa bin Abdulaziz Al-Thani, Prime Minister and Minister of Interior of Qatar are engaging on the arrangement that will ride on an existing bilateral agreement on security,” noted the Ministry of Interior on social media.

Matiang’i added that Nairobi and Doha were also in talks to operationalize the Qatar Visa Centre in Nairobi to expedite services including to the over 37,000 Kenyans working in the Gulf State.

In attendance during the celebrations was Director of Public Prosecutions Noordin Haji, the Ethics and Anti-Corruption Commission boss Twalib Mubarak, Health Principal Secretary Susan Mochache and members of both the National Assembly and Senate.

The World Cup will begin on November 22, 2022, and will run for one month until December 22, 2022.

Kenya missed out on qualifying for the global showpiece having gained six points from six games in the group qualifiers, with Mali top with 16 points. Kenya is below Uganda who has 9 points.

Either Portugal or Italy risks missing out on the tournament in Qatar after they were drawn together in the second phase of the playoff draw. Italy, who won the Euro 2020 tournament this year had missed out on the 2018 FIFA World Cup.

They will take on North Macedonia initially, with Portugal facing Turkey, and should both the seeded nations emerge unscathed from those ties, they will then face off for a place at the 2022 World Cup. That means the 2022 World Cup will be without the Euro 2020 winners, or Cristiano Ronaldo.

All eyes will also be on some of the major talents, such as Italy’s Marco Verratti, Poland’s Robert Lewandowski, Wales’ Gareth Bale, Sweden’s Zlatan Ibrahimovic, or Austria’s David Alaba who could miss out on the tournament.

headline: 21-Year-Old Jack Of All Trades Is The Latest Omoka Na Moti Winner
author: Bosco Mbugua

breadcrumbs.name: 21-Year-Old Jack Of All Trades Is The Latest Omoka Na Moti Winner

description: (26) Leading sports betting firm Mozzartbet’s motor latest promotion continues to attract punters with the latest winner coming from Kakamega County. Mozzartbet has two promotions running concurrently: Urban Cruiser and Omoka na Moti with a combined value of Ksh50 million. The Urban Cruiser Promotion is a one-off reward for a lucky punter who will have • Read More »
articleBody:
Leading sports betting firm Mozzartbet ’s motor latest promotion continues to attract punters with the latest winner coming from Kakamega County.

Mozzartbet Urban Cruiser and Omoka na Moti with a combined value of Ksh50 million.

The Urban Cruiser Promotion is a one-off reward for a lucky punter who will have strung together the longest winning multi-bet by 19 th December 2021.

The only conditions tied to Urban Cruiser Promotion is every entry in the bet slip must have 1.35 odds and above with a stake not less than Ksh50.

So far one punter has led the chase for this Urban Cruiser for over two weeks having mustered a 26-game winning ticket with the closest pursuer stuck on 24 games.

#OmokaNaMoti pic.twitter.com/B0vRO7Atfo

— Boniface 🇰🇪 (@kilundeezy) December 8, 2021

Omoka na Moti Promotion on the other hand gives a car daily to one punter who conjures a winning ticket with the highest accumulation of odds each day. The only conditions attached to this promotion is a fifty bob stake or more for one to qualify.

The latest winner of the Omoka na Moti Promotion is 21-year old Lenox Shimanyula from Kakamega. In his own words, he is a jack of all trades.

“I don’t have a job description. I do anything that is legal to make money. I might be young but I have learnt the art of business from my family. I am multi-skilled and do a lot of things including driving heavy commercial vehicles at times to earn my daily bread,” Shimanyula says.

On Monday evening, Shimanyula placed Ksh 200 on a stake on just four games with combined odds of 311.6. While doing this, he had no idea he would win a brand new Proton Saga car worth Ksh 1.5 Million.

“I needed some cash to clear a loan that was bothering me. So I quickly analyzed five games but decided on just four since the fifth one was to be played in the wee hours of the morning and I was in dire need of money. Luckily I won slightly over Ksh 47,000 and quickly settled the loan. That was it and I slept a happy man,”

“However, I was surprised when I received a call from Mozzart Bet confirming me as the winner of a car in their ongoing Omoka Na Moti Promotion. I honestly did not expect it and I am really happy.” Shimanyula opens up.

Shimanyula has a car that he hires out on self-drive and he now plans to expand the business with the new car.

“This car has come at the right time especially during the festive season. My vision is to have more cars to hire out in the near future and therefore this is a good start.” He said.

Shimanyula advises punters to use Mozzart Bet as it is a trusted brand.

“I come from Kakamega and Mozzart sponsors our local team Kakamega Homeboyz – that is how I came to know about them and I have trusted them ever since. The most interesting thing I love about the company is the Monday bonus. I rarely miss it and as a matter of fact, I used a portion of the bonus I got on Monday to place this winning bet.” He concludes.

headline: Pomp And Colour as Kawangware Carpenter Claims His Omoka na Moti Prize
author: By Bosco Mbugua

breadcrumbs.name: Pomp And Colour as Kawangware Carpenter Claims His Omoka na Moti Prize

description: Airo was the 5th winner of the promotion, being the newest Proton Saga owner
articleBody:
There was pomp and color as leading sports betting firm Mozzartbet presented Kawangware-based carpenter Simon Airo with his Omoka na Moti Promotion prize, a brand new Proton Saga at his backyard.

Airo was the 5th winner of the promotion, being the newest Proton Saga owner after predicting 10 games that had total odds of 810.98 correctly.

Still stuck to the analog way of having tangible proof, Airo was the first of the winners in the promotion so far to have done so after staking over the counter and to make it special and memorable, Mozzartbet visited Airo in Kawangware to present him with his car and the residents of Kawangware came out in big numbers to see one of their own drive his way to car ownership

He casually placed his bet at the Kawangware Mozzartbet shop on Saturday, as he has always been doing, then went about his woodwork business in the sprawling informal settlement, only that this time his Ksh 50 would come bearing more gifts.

“I feel very good having won a car with Mozzartbet. I have been betting for a while but it did not hit me that there is a day I would own a car from only 50 bob. I will not stop at the car, I will continue betting because I know I can win more than that. Anyone can transform their 50 shillings to a car with Mozzartbet just like I did,” an elated Airo said.

Beatrice Achieng, a cashier at Kawangware Mozzartbet shop revealed that at some point Airo wanted to change his car-winning ticket after placing his bet but was time-barred.

“He comes in the morning, picks the fixtures and goes to analyze then comes back later to stake. On Saturday, after staking he became a bit hesitant on his pick in the Westham and Chelsea game and even wanted to cancel the bet but time did not allow. He wanted to bet on Chelsea as opposed to Westham. On Sunday, he came to collect his winnings in the morning and I served him because I was the one at the main counter. At that time, we did not know that he was the winner for the previous day but later the main office called and notified us that the person we had paid was the winner for the day. We counterchecked the time stamp of when we had paid him against the CCTV image and started looking for him, luckily it was easy because there was someone around who knew him,” Achieng narrated.

Kawangware Mozzartbet Shop manager Brian Kibichii congratulated Airo and urged punters to continue playing with Mozzartbet now that they had experienced the reality of the promotion in their own backyard.

“You have seen that the promotion is very real and Simo will be walking away with a brand new Proton Saga. You could be the next one who walks away with this car or even the 9 million Kenya shillings house,” Kibichii said.

Mozzartbet have two promotions running concurrently: Urban Cruiser and Omoka na Moti with a combined value of Ksh50 million.

The Urban Cruiser Promotion is a one-off reward for a lucky punter who will have strung together the longest winning multi-bet by 19th December 2021.

The only conditions tied to Urban Cruiser Promotion is every entry in the bet slip must have 1.35 odds and above with a stake not less than Ksh50.

So far one punter has led the chase for this Urban Cruiser for over two weeks having mustered a 26-game winning ticket with the closest pursuer stuck on 24 games.

Omoka na Moti Promotion on the other hand gives a car daily to one punter who conjures a winning ticket with the highest accumulation of odds each day. The only conditions attached to this promotion is a fifty bob stake or more for one to qualify.

How to participate

1. Promotion duration: from 1.12.2021 (00:01 h) to 31.12.2021 (23:59 h)

2. The beginning of all sports events on the ticket must not be earlier than 00:01, December 1st, 2021. Otherwise, the ticket is not taken into account. I.e., it does not meet the conditions for participation in the promotion.

3. All bet slips must be from that promotional day. The beginning of the last sports event that is on the bet slip must be no later than 11:59 PM on the day when the bet slip was played. Bet slips that have matches from several promotional days are not included in the promotion.

4. DAILY PRIZE: The winner of the daily prize i.e. the car, is one participant daily who will have won a multi-bet with the highest total winning odds for that day of December, during the promotion. This means the multi-bet must be won in-order to qualify for the promotion.

5. GRAND PRIZE: On top of the CAR, at the end of December 2021, Mozzart bet will also reward only 1 out of the 31 winners who will have attained the highest total winning odds (best winning ticket out of the 31) with an Apartment in Nairobi.

6. Place a multi-bet of a minimum 4 games.

7. The minimum stake on your Multi-bet must be Ksh 50.

8. If a sporting event in your multi-bet is canceled for any reason, odds of 1 are calculated for that event, but the multi-bet still participates in the prize game, but that sporting event is not taken into account for calculation.

9. In the event that the kick-off of a sporting event is postponed, the ticket still participates in the promotion, but will wait a maximum of 50 hours to confirm the outcome of the event.

10. In case that two or more participants have same total winning odds, the participant who paid the multi-bet first, has the advantage.

11. All events on the Bet-slip must be sports events (results of individual or group sports events, a certain event during a sports competition, etc.)

12. Live Bet tickets, Jackpot tickets, my number, Lucky super 6 and Virtual tickets do not qualify.

headline: I Did Not Try To Rape Diana Marua- Willy Paul (VIDEO)
author: By Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: I Did Not Try To Rape Diana Marua- Willy Paul (VIDEO)

description: Marua recalled how she met the controversial gospel singer at a movie shop while he flirted with him.
articleBody:
UPDATE 11.55pm: Kenyan singer Wilson Abubakar Radido, alias Willy Paul has denied allegations that he tried to rape rapper Diana Marua, alias Diana B, as she revealed in her YouTube video.

Willy Paul absolved himself from her accusations, noting that she lied to the public that he attempted to rape her, despite the ideology that she would not believe him.

“I know she won’t believe, but that’s a big lie. I have never raped anyone! Tell your husband (Bahati) the truth.

Willy Paul denies trying to rape Diana Marua #ViralVideos

— Viral Tea Kenya (@ViralTeaKe) December 9, 2021

“Tell him that you slept at my house and something happened at that time. Whatever allegations you have against me are not true and you know that,” he affirmed, adding that he only gave her his number and Instagram details.

Kenyan artist Wilson Abubakar Radido, alias Willy Paul has been dragged into fresh rape allegations, this time involving rapper Diana Marua, alias Diana B.

Taking to her YouTube channel on Thursday, December 9, a teary Marua narrated how a few years back, Willy Paul had been pursuing her while she was living along Mombasa Road at Great Wall Apartments around the Syokimau area.

Marua recalled how she met the controversial gospel singer at a movie shop while he flirted with her. He had invited her to his house but she turned him down on the basis that she did not know him well.

Willy Paul then lured her into his car as an alternative, locked the doors of the vehicle thus trapping her inside with him before he sped off.

“I get in the car, the guy locks the car, he drives off and puts loud music so I’m like ‘What are you doing, where are we going’. So he’s like he’s not talking he’s being touchy and all that, he’s driving the car like he doesn’t want to know,” she said while she broke down.

Marua narrated that it had taken her nearly three years to share the ordeal, even with her husband, singer Kevin Kioko Mbuvi, alias Bahati. She was under pressure to narrate her story as many women had narrated similar tales to the public but have been ignored.

Willy Paul then took Marua to an apartment and invited her to climb up to his house, but she refused and demanded to be dropped back home. Angered, he tried to force her up into his house and allegedly attempted to assault her sexually.

“He came on top of me and he started pulling my skirt up…he’s tearing my skirt and my top so I’m like what are you doing, I’m trying to scream and trying to tell him to get off me. So I started screaming, this guy was choking me so that I cannot scream,” she went on.

Willy Paul was taken aback by the screams and moved away from her. Marua saw the move as a chance to escape from the apartment with torn clothes and into the darkness surrounding the murram road until she spotted a boda boda rider who came to her aid.

“So eventually, after the screams, under the process of screaming he panicked and moved away from me, that is the time I got a chance to open the door and I ran. A boda boda rider helped me, I boarded his bike and went back home,” she narrated.

Marua added that she was triggered to expose him to the public after Willy Paul had recorded a diss track towards her a few days ago, claiming that he had slept with her.

“Willy Paul has the audacity to come out and say that he slept with me, he attempted to rape me,” she faulted him.

She added that she has already taken legal measures against Willy Paul and will fight for justice. Additionally, she has in her possession an Occurrence Book (OB) number obtained from the police station.

In a message on his Instagram page which he deleted on Friday, December 3, Willy Paul warned Marua to exercise caution against him, adding that he won’t let her go scot-free. Marua had earlier on dismissed Willy Paul’s comments on her music made earlier as mere jealousy given that the song broke records within such a short time.

She added that she did not know of Willy Paul’s latest track and how it has performed in the Kenyan music industry. Affirming the fact that numbers don’t lie, Marua claimed that she was already ahead of the Kitanzi hitmaker.

“First of all I don’t even know Willy Paul’s last song and I don’t even know how his song did, I just joined the industry the other day and my numbers don’t lie. I think he is hating because I am ahead of him despite being in the industry for three days.” Diana said.

“I just feel like he is hating because I am ahead of him and it has just been three days while he has been here for years. Please, just give me a break,” she responded.

Willy Paul further countered her claims that she is further ahead of him, accusing her and Bahati, of buying views to her YouTube channel where her first song Hatutaachana was uploaded.

“Diana, you know our issues. Please be very careful with what you say about me. Just because your husband used three shillings to buy your YouTube views as he did, don’t be cheated. We are not competing or beefing against each other,” he responded.

headline: Mulamwah Closes Record Label, Fires Signee
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Mulamwah Closes Record Label, Fires Signee

description: Mulamwah explained the decision to close the label as being out of too much hatred from netizens
articleBody:
Comedian David Oyando, alias Mulamwah’s drama has taken another twist as he announced on Wednesday, December 8 that he closed down his record label Mulamwah Entertainment and sent home his signee Vall Wambo.

In a statement on Instagram, Mulamwah explained the decision to close the label as being out of too much hatred from netizens which began when his ex-girlfriend and baby mama, Carol Muthoni, alias Carrol Sonie, announced that she dumped him.

He added that he wanted to protect Wambo from online trolls, hence leading to the closure. He praised her for having a bright future ahead of her and had wanted to use the label to take her to greater heights.

“I am sorry Vall Wambo, you are still very young and with a promising future, my dream was to see you grow into a big star, not only you but many more too.

“So unfortunate that the environment created online is not healthy at all, all the trolls and abuse online should not be your portion,” he wrote.

He weighed in on his experiences with online trolls which he claimed have made it difficult for him to progress as a comedian and online content creator.

“I was there before and I don’t want you at the same spot. It’s quite difficult to progress with all this friction,” he noted.

He announced further that he would close Mulamwah Entertainment indefinitely and that everything Wambo created entirely belongs to her.

Additionally, he deleted all the songs by Wambo from his end and promised to turn over the videos to her to post wherever she pleases.

“I hereby announce the indefinite closure of Mulamwah ent. Everything created for you belongs to you and you own 100% of your music and all the accounts created.

“All the songs have been deleted from our end, you’ll be given the videos to post on whatever channel of your choice. All the best,” he addressed her.

“Kindly accord her all the support she needs. To the others too, seek solace elsewhere,” he advised.

Mulamwah welcomed Wambo in October to his record label as the first signed artist, wishing her the best in her career as he released a new song.

“Welcome to MULAMWAH ENT Vall Wambo as the first signed artist. Wishing you all the best in your career ahead. Meanwhile, Enjoy the cover (Dawa ya Baridi), link on bio” shared Mulamwah.

Spot checks on her Instagram profile revealed that Wambo was only featured in a K24 interview.

The decision makes his woes much worse after he came out on Tuesday, December 7 in response to the breakup between him and Sonie. He took to Instagram on Tuesday, December 7 to share a photo of him with her seated facing each other, with Sonie just on top of him on a quad bike.

In his carefully-worded statement, he affirmed that it was only them who knew what happened that led to the termination of the relationship.

He added that they had separated a long time ago but had to put their house in order before Sonie announced to the public on Monday, December 6 of the development.

“This is my favourite picture of us in my gallery, only you and I know what memories it evokes and what prevailed after. It has been the best experience with you by my side. Sad, but Carrol & I decided to call it quits.

“We both decided to separate a very long time ago but we so it fit to also put everything straight that we are no longer together as partners. Of course, our beautiful daughter’s priorities come first, and she will never lack anything within my reach,” part of Mulamwah’s post read.

He affirmed that he was not clout-chasing, even after he had unveiled Sonie’s replacement in form of an unidentified lady on his page. A photo showed him wrapping his new bae around her shoulder as she leaned suggestively towards him.

Mulamwah has since posted two videos of the lady on his page and is yet to reveal her identity.

headline: Omanyala Eyes Usain Bolt’s World Record
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Omanyala Eyes Usain Bolt’s World Record

description: The rugby-player-turned-sprinter warmed the hearts of Kenyans by clocking an impressive African best time of 9.77s breaking the 9.85s record by South African Akuni Sembine
articleBody:
Kenyan sprinter Ferdinand Omanyala Omurwa has set his sights on the 9.58 world record held by Jamaican sprinting legend Usain Bolt.

The rugby-player-turned-sprinter warmed the hearts of Kenyans by clocking an impressive African best time of 9.77s breaking the 9.85s record by South African Akuni Sembine at the Kip-Keino Classics held at the Moi International Sports Centre, Kasarani on September 18, 2021.

Speaking to Radio Citizen on Tuesday, December 14, Omanyala expressed his desire to break the world record in the near future, adding that his 2021 saw him break the African record.

He added that competing against some of the world’s best was no easy task, but they inspired him to keep going and continue with his dream of smashing the record.

“I think 2021 has been my year, I was targeting to break the African record which I managed but now focus shifts to the world record.

“Competing against the world greatest like Americans Trayvon Bromell and Justin Gatlin wasn’t easy, and they always encouraged me and I believe I can break Bolt record,” he said.

On August 16, 2009, Usain Bolt clocked 9.58 seconds in the final of the 100 meters at the IAAF World Championships in Berlin, Germany. It is one that has stood for twelve years now.

Omanyala then urged the government to focus on improving the stadiums to a standard fit for athletes across the world to compete in, not just in athletics but in sport in general.

headline: GSU Graduates In Viral Video Will Remain At Training Centre
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: GSU Graduates In Viral Video Will Remain At Training Centre

description: Shioso was thus surprised at their behaviour given that the unit exudes one of the highest standards of discipline among the police units.
articleBody:
The newly-graduated General Service Unit (GSU) officers who made lewd remarks in a video that went viral on Wednesday, December 8 will not be deployed to their stations until the conclusion of investigations into their behaviour.

National Police Service (NPS) Spokesperson Bruno Shioso stated that the graduates will remain at the National Police College Embakasi B Campus in Nairobi where the graduations were held while the rest of the graduates were posted to their stations.

The officers whose actions were deemed to have scared members of the public will be probed on how they joined the GSU force for the first time as well as what motivated them to join the force.

Shioso noted that the officers were young and very excited about serving the nation for the first time and the day was a big one given that President Uhuru Kenyatta was also in attendance.

“Of course, we understand these are young officers who are full of excitement for their 1st day of service. It was a big day also in terms of the chief guest present but there must be a review of what happened.

“We can’t make assumptions. We are also seeking to establish their motivation to join the service because they must fit the requirements of modern-day service,” Shioso told the Nation.

The police spokesperson also said that the investigations will also seek to establish the exact number of officers in the video before enforcing disciplinary action against them.

The group was part of the 2,502 constables who graduated as GSU officers at the National Police Training College in Embakasi B Campus after rigorous training at the Magadi Training Camp in Kajiado County.

Because of the vigorous training that the unit undergoes, the GSU is one of the most disciplined units in the police force and one of the most feared within the NPS.

Its officers join the elite teams such as the Presidential Escort and Recce Squad, with others deployed as riot control and provision of security to foreign airlines.

“Your unit in particular and your reputation for bravery, excellence and unfailing commitment to duty is also unrivalled which also I believe is a sign of the discipline and excellent training that is at the heart of GSU training. I call upon you graduates today to ensure that the GSU flame of excellence continues to burn,” President Uhuru said during his call to the graduates.

Shioso was thus surprised at their behaviour given that the unit exudes one of the highest standards of discipline among the police units.

“I personally took a while to understand why they had done it. This is our premium and the most tactical unit that we rely on because of its discipline. More is expected especially on the unit’s officers, they should be beyond reproach,” he noted.

The video seen by Viral Tea showed the officers filming themselves making insensitive comments in Sheng, particularly war cries seemingly aimed at members of the public, if not their enemies.

NPS issued a statement on the matter later on Wednesday after it sparked uproar across the country, affirming that action would be taken against the officers.

It termed their behaviour as unacceptable to the values of the police force in the country, noting that all its graduands went through rigorous training designed to make them responsible officers to better serve Kenyans.

“Attention of the National Police Service is drawn to a video clip circulating on social media depicting newly graduated General Service Unit (GSU) officers recording themselves as they make some irresponsible and reckless remarks. We wish to clarify and assure the public that the behaviour portrayed in the clip is not acceptable and does not reflect the values of the GSU, Kenya Police Service and the National Police Service.

“All graduands went through a rigorous value-based training modelled on democratic policing principles and designed to make them responsive and responsible officers of the law at the service of citizens. The oath of allegiance they took as part of their graduation is a testament to the sanctity of their duty to serve,” noted the NPS.

author: Marvin Chege

description: NPS issued a statement on the matter later on Wednesday after it sparked uproar across the country, affirming that action will be take against the officers.
articleBody:
A video showing newly-graduated General Service Unit (GSU) officers making lewd remarks went viral on Wednesday, December 8 and has now drawn the attention of the National Police Service (NPS).

The video seen by Viral Tea showed the officers filming themselves making insensitive comments in Sheng, particularly war cries seemingly aimed to members of the public, if not their enemies.

NPS issued a statement on the matter later on Wednesday after it sparked uproar across the country, affirming that action will be take against the officers.

Meanwhile what do you think of the new General Service Unit (GSU) soldiers passing out today? #ViralVideos pic.twitter.com/mLibo6S1kp

— Viral Tea Kenya (@ViralTeaKe) December 8, 2021

It termed their behaviour as unacceptable to the values of the police force in the country, noting that all its graduands went through rigorous training designed to make them responsible officers to better serve Kenyans.

“Attention of the National Police Service is drawn to a video clip circulating on social media depicting newly graduated General Service Unit (GSU) officers recording themselves as they make some irresponsible and reckless remarks. We wish to clarify and assure the public that the behaviour portrayed in the clip is not acceptable and does not reflect the values of the GSU, Kenya Police Service and the National Police Service.

“All graduands went through a rigorous value-based training modelled on democratic policing principles and designed to make them responsive and responsible officers of the law at the service of citizens. The oath of allegiance they took as part of their graduation is a testament to the sanctity of their duty to service,” noted the NPS.

The police body termed their remarks as regrettable and subject to condemnation.

“The remarks as made in the clip are therefore regrettable and stand condemned,” added the NPS.

It was further carrying out internal reviews before deciding on what action to take on the matter.

The video went viral at the same time President Uhuru Kenyatta presided over the 48th passing-out-parade of the GSU at the National Police College Embakasi B Campus in Nairobi County where 2,502 new officers were incorporated into the service.

During the parade, Uhuru opened up on the mental issues that have been dogging security officers from time immemorial.

Seemingly referring to the events whereby Police Constable Benson Imbatu shot indiscriminately at innocent members of the public in Kabete, Kiambu County after he killed his wife, Uhuru urged police officers to speak up if they have any issues to avoid scenarios where the officers commit murder-suicides.

“There is no need to result in harmful practices. Your gun should be used to save lives, not take them,” the President noted.

The Head of State encouraged the newly-graduated officers, and in general security officers nationwide to reach out to those close to them; peers, family members, even employers so that their issues can be resolved.

“Please step forward. There is no shame in it…we can find solutions and help you become even better officers,” he appealed.

headline: Kabete Killings Draws Uhuru’s Attention (VIDEO)
author: Marvin Chege
description: He was addressing 2,502 newly graduated General Service Unit (GSU) police officers at their Embakasi B Campus in Nairobi County on Wednesday, December 8
articleBody:
The shootings that occurred in Kabete, Kiambu County on Tuesday, December 7 have been the talk of the country for the past day and have now drawn the attention of President Uhuru Kenyatta.

He was addressing 2,502 newly graduated General Service Unit (GSU) police officers at their Embakasi B Campus in Nairobi County on Wednesday, December 8 when he opened up on the mental issues that have been dogging security officers from time immemorial.

Seemingly referring to the events whereby Police Constable Benson Imbatu shot indiscriminately at innocent members of the public after he killed his wife, Uhuru urged police officers to speak up if they have any issues to avoid scenarios where the officers commit murder-suicides.

“There is no need to result in harmful practices. Your gun should be used to save lives, not take them,” the President noted.

The Head of State encouraged the newly-graduated officers, and in general security officers nationwide to reach out to those close to them; peers, family members, even employers so that their issues can be resolved.

“Please step forward. There is no shame in it…we can find solutions and help you become even better officers,” he appealed.

His sentiments come after one Moses Mwea, aged 22 years, narrated how he had survived the massacre whereby Imbasi murdered six people before turning the gun on himself.

Mwea was with his friend while walking in the wee hours of the morning when he ran into Imbasi, who ordered them to stop and raise their hands. The duo, who were returning from a night vigil, had complied with the order.

Kabete shooting victim recounts gun attack by a police officer, Benson Imbatu, that left 7 dead pic.twitter.com/QXZxEv8Qjq

— NTV Kenya (@ntvkenya) December 8, 2021

The two thought they were under arrest, but the cop shot at them. Mwea’s friend was shot on his chest, with the bullet grazing his arm. During their escape, the cop opened fire and shot the man fatally on his head.

“I then ran for safety, but when my friend tried to run, he was then shot on his chest. He did not have the running speed I had and was later shot on his head. That is how he died on the spot,” he revealed to journalists.

The survivor added that he ran away from the scene towards the vigil with blood oozing from his arm when he turned around and realised that his friend was shot and killed. The mourners administered first aid to him and rushed him to the hospital.

Lifedi, a resident of Kabete, was murdered in April this year, and IPOA took over the investigations.

On Tuesday, the officer went on an overnight rampage and killed six people before he shot and killed himself, according to authorities.

“The officer first killed his wife in their home, shooting her in the neck, before setting off at 3 am with his service-issued AK-47 rifle and starting to shoot at “innocent members of the public frenziedly,” DCI said on Tuesday.

Three of the men killed by the “rogue” were mourners who had just attended preparations for a funeral.

After the incident, Interior Cabinet Secretary, Fred Matiang’i, said that the shooting spree could have been triggered by a disagreement between the officer and his wife.

“The Government is saddened by the Kabete incident, involving a police officer, that left six people dead. We are sending our condolences to the affected families. Preliminary investigations suggest the incident may have been triggered by a love triangle gone awry,” he said on Tuesday.

headline: Uhuru Unveils New Statue In Nairobi (PHOTOS)
author: By Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Uhuru Unveils New Statue In Nairobi (PHOTOS)

description: To facilitate the unveiling, one side of the street, which is a terminus for several Nairobi matatus including those plying the Umoja and Githurai 45 routes, was closed to traffic on Saturday.
articleBody:
President Uhuru Kenyatta on Saturday morning, December 11 unveiled the statue of Kenyan independence hero, pan-Africanist and former Cabinet Minister, the late Ronald Gideon Ngala on Ronald Ngala Street in Nairobi CBD.

Photos seen by Viral Tea showed the new statue standing tall in view of pedestrians and motorists using the road, with the posture of the late Ronald Ngala waving to the masses with his walking stick.

To facilitate the unveiling, one side of the street, which is a terminus for several Nairobi matatus including those plying the Umoja and Githurai 45 routes, was closed to traffic on Saturday.

“One side of Ronald Ngala in Nairobi CBD is closed, no motorist allowed looks like there some function near where Githurai mats stop. Alternative route advised if drive along that route,” a pedestrian was quoted by Ma3Route on Twitter.

The Head of State was accompanied by Sports CS Amina Mohamed and Head of Public Service Dr Joseph Kinyua among other senior government officials during the unveiling of the statue.

Also present was the family of the late political supremo, celebrated for ‘majimboism’, a precursor of modern-day devolution, led by his son and former long-serving Cabinet Minister, Hon Noah Katana Ngala.

The unveiling follows Uhuru’s return from Tanzania where he oversaw the signing of eight bilateral agreements after bilateral talks between Kenyan and Tanzanian delegations that he led alongside his Tanzanian counterpart Samia Suluhu Hassan at State House in Dar es Salaam.

On Sunday, December 12, he is expected to inaugurate the refurbished Uhuru Gardens in Nairobi while at the same capacity hosting the Jamhuri Day celebrations from there, expected to draw roughly 11,000 people under strict COVID-19 protocols.

The late Ronald Ngala was a politician who served as leader of the Kenya African Democratic Union (KADU) political party and has been standing by it from its formation in 1960 until it was dissolved in 1964.

He was born in 1922 at Gotani in Kilifi County. In 1929 the family moved to Vishakani near Kaloleni, which became his permanent residence.

Ngala attended the Alliance High School and Makerere University College where he got a teaching diploma. He worked as a teacher in the coastal region before being promoted to be the headmaster of Mbale Secondary School in Taita-Taveta District. In 1952 he was transferred to Buxton School in Mombasa where he served as the principal.

Ngala was believed to have played a role in the release of Kenya’s founding father the late Mzee Jomo Kenyatta and his KADU party fell short of the Kenya African National Union (KANU) in the 1961 legislative council elections. However, its leaders had refused to form a government until Mzee Kenyatta was released from house arrest, which happened later that year.

He was made Minister of Cooperatives and Social Services in the Kenyatta government before he rose to become one of KANU’s vice-presidents at the 1966 Limuru Conference in which ODM leader Raila Odinga’s father Oginga Odinga was ejected from the party. He remained active in government until he died in a road accident in 1972 under suspicious circumstances.

headline: MP Chased From VIP Entrance Of Raila’s Event (VIDEO)
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: MP Chased From VIP Entrance Of Raila’s Event (VIDEO)

description: The officers had a tough time trying to contain the incensed crowd for hours as Raila began streaming into the stadium.
articleBody:
UPDATE 1.12 pm: Maragua MP Mary Wamaua was forced to leave the Azimio La Umoja event at Kasarani, Nairobi after she alleged she was roughed up by security officers in plain clothes at the gate.

The lawmaker, who is an ally of Deputy President William Ruto was frozen by the security detail at the VIP entrance and responded to the hostile welcome by shouting down the officers who had shoved her off the barricade.

She could be heard mocking the officers that they would do the same thing if ODM leader Raila Odinga is elected president.

“How will things be when you reach State House? We want individuals who have humility! I am a Member of Parliament but you’re pushing me away like a sack of potatoes,” she could be heard ranting before leaving the area but by the time of publication, it was not established whether she left the stadium.

Maragwa MP Mary Wamaua leaves Kasarani Stadium, alleges she was roughed up by security men in plain clothes at the gate #AzimioLaUmoja pic.twitter.com/d3ulvkxkwp

— TheStarKenya (@TheStarKenya) December 10, 2021

Former Prime Minister and Orange Democratic Movement (ODM) leader, Raila Odinga’s Azimio La Umoja event at Kasarani, Nairobi.

Viral Tea showed security officers trying to contain an angry crowd that began charging down on the officers at the entrance before they forced their way in.

headline: Kenyans Looked For True Love On Google In 2021- Report
author: Marvin Chege

breadcrumbs.name: Kenyans Looked For True Love On Google In 2021- Report

description: The search giant released its list of the most searched topics and trends for the whole year on Wednesday, December 7 through its Google Trends platform
articleBody:
Kenyans especially residing in Nairobi who have been through several relationships spent the whole of 2021 searching on Google for how to find true love, its report has revealed.

The search giant released its list of the most searched topics and trends for the whole year on Wednesday, December 7 through its Google Trends platform which monitors trends across the country and the world’s internet space.

Kenyans combed through copious articles that have offered different versions of finding true love which has been debated for many years. Some believe that it does not exist, given the nature of modern relationships in the country while the avid romantics opined that everyone should find their soulmates.

“True love and lust are two different things. While one is easy to find, the other takes a lot of work to grow and maintain, the one that requires a couple to be through thick and thin,” this writer believes.

Coming in second was how to check for results of the Kenya Certificate of Primary Education (KCPE) and its secondary counterpart KCSE online, given the national attention that is annually directed to those who top their classes as well as what to do next after getting the results.

The ‘Year in Search’ also revealed that Kenyans sought answers for how to pay for NHIF services via MPESA as well as how to reverse transactions using the mobile money platform. Also included was how to apply for Kazi Mtaani, which saw over 1 million Kenyans apply for the initiative’s third phase under the steering committee of the National Hygiene Program.

How to write an application letter and a curriculum vitae (CV), how to buy tokens (Kenya Power) and how to style braids closed off the ‘How To’ general list of the year.

On the general list, the English Premier League (EPL) table topped, followed by the election results of Uganda and Kiambaa as well as the IEBC. Manchester City, Liverpool and Chelsea dominate the top three spots respectively this season going into the festive period.

The ruling regarding the Building Bridges Initiative (BBI) Constitutional Amendment Bill was also featured amongst the top searches after it was thrown out twice by the High Court and Court of Appeal, and petitions to save it have been filed at the Supreme Court.

In terms of losses, the late Tanzanian President John Pombe Magufuli topped the list followed by businessman Chris Kirubi, legendary rapper DMX, Prince Phillip, Simeon Nyachae among others.

Majority of top searches regarding health centred on the COVID-19 vaccine in the country.

headline: Uhuru Gives CBK New Powers Over Digital Loan Apps
author: By Viral Tea Ke

breadcrumbs.name: Uhuru Gives CBK New Powers Over Digital Loan Apps

description: (16) Digital loan apps in Kenya have a period of six months to register with the Central Bank of Kenya (CBK) according to an amendment bill signed by President Uhuru Kenyatta. The President on Tuesday, December 7 at State House, Nairobi assented to the Central Bank of Kenya (Amendment) Bill, Public-Private Partnership Bill, and Trustees • Read More »
articleBody:
Digital loan apps in Kenya have a period of six months to register with the Central Bank of Kenya (CBK) according to an amendment bill signed by President Uhuru Kenyatta.

The President on Tuesday, December 7 at State House, Nairobi assented to the Central Bank of Kenya (Amendment) Bill, Public-Private Partnership Bill, and Trustees (Perpetual Succession) (Amendment) Act, all of 2021.

The amended Central Bank Act, 2021, gives the Central Bank of Kenya powers to license digital lenders in the country as well as ensure the existence of fair and non-discriminatory practices in the credit market.

As a consequence, the Competition Authority of Kenya (CAK) requires digital lenders to provide interest rates, late payment, and rollover fees for their loans before dishing out loans to their customers. Its report revealed that 77 per cent of mobile loan borrowers have been forced to pay penalties and charged to roll over their debts.

Data from the CBK showed that borrowers borrowing digital loans from unregulated lenders rose from 200,000 in 2016 to more than two million in 2019.

The new bill is a huge blow to the digital lenders who have expressed their fearlessness towards regulations.

However, they were sceptical of the government regulating them which might hurt their businesses. Through the Digital Lenders Association, the lenders had started “regulating themselves.”

The CBK in November offered Kenyans a relief by suspending the listing of negative credit information for borrowers with loans below Kenya Shillings (Ksh.) 5 million, whose loans were performing previously, but have become non-performing from October 1, 2021.

Loans below Ksh5 million that fall in arrears from October 1, 2021, to September 30, 2022, will not lead to the “blacklisting” of the borrower on the Credit Reference Bureaus (CRBs). Further, CRBs will not include in any credit report, any negative credit information for loans of a customer less than Ksh5 million submitted to the CRB from October 1, 2020, to September 30, 2021, for a period of 12 months from October 1, 2021, to September 30, 2022

On its part, the new Public-Private Partnerships Act repeals the 2013 legislation by providing an elaborate legal framework to cover both national and county level PPP projects.

Further, the new law expands the role of the private sector in PPP initiatives beyond financing to include construction, operation and maintenance of the projects.

The Trustees (Perpetual Succession) (Amendment) Act, passed by the National Assembly on October 19, 2021, seeks to simplify the registration of trusts by, among other reforms, shifting the administration of the process to the new office of the principal registrar of documents.
